characters: AT THE END OF THE BLOCK
BACK TO SCENE IN POSE CLUB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6:00am on an ALARM CLOCK.  It BUZZES. CREDIT SEQUENCE BEGINS... In bed, under a black-light poster of Zodiac signs portra as sexual positions, KITTLE opens his eyes.  He's dashing handsome, with a bushy moustache and big mutton chops. In the MIRROR ON THE CEILING: Kittle admires himself, the gets up, leaving behind a naked, BEAUTIFUL WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should hit the bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman is starting to regret last night. IN THE KITCHEN, Kittle opens the fridge, puts a shrink-wrapped steak on the counter,  A carton of eggs. He lights a burner under a skillet. IN THE BEDROOM, the woman sits up, wraps herself in a she She notices a PICTURE hung crooked on the wall: A PHOTO OF KITTLE in dress blues, fresh from the police academy; a Kittle once clean-cut, crew-cut and untainted. A Kittle long dead. IN THE KITCHEN, Kittle dumps the steak in the skillet.  H cracks eggs as the woman comes to pose in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't I even get breakfast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks at her, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6:00am.  An ALARM CLOCK RINGS.  BILLY-BOY's already up, a outsized, scruffy-faced bruiser with mutton chops rivalin Kittle's.  He's lifting weights, naked, covered in sweat, smoking a cigarette. His gun and badge wait in a holster on a chair. Billy-Boy drops the barbells, executing kung-fu moves, poorly.  He chops at imaginary foes as he exits.  A momen later, he crosses back with a six-pack of beer... IN THE BATHROOM, Billy-Boy gets in the shower, guzzling a beer.  He tosses the empty, turns on the water... Blasted by the cold spray, Billy-Boy throws back his head and lets out a long, loud WAR HOOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALARM CLOCK.  6:00am again, as the ALARM BUZZES... In the satin-sheeted bed, a Siamese cat leaps up and rubs against NENA.  Nena rolls over, black and beautiful, straightens her power Afro.  She pets the cat, pushes awa her pillow and picks up her GUN there. IN THE KITCHEN, Nena puts the gun down and fills a coffee pot at the sink.  The cat circles her ankles, purring. Nena opens a can of tuna, dumps it on a plate and puts it the floor.  The cat eats. Nena opens the refrigerator where a photo of Bruce Lee is taped to the door.  She takes out a coffee jar, revealing GUN hidden behind it on the shelf. In a cabinet, she pushes aside another GUN to get a mug. Nena sits at a table to wait for water to boil.  She pick thru a box of electronic bits and pieces, tinkering with MICRO-TRANSMITTER, using a jeweler's eyepiece.  CAMERA MO down... REVEALS a HOLSTER screwed to the underside of tab another GUN within reach. IN THE BEDROOM, Nena enters with coffee.  She kneels cross-legged in a bean-bag chair, lights incense, then sh her eyes and begins her morning meditation with a low hum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a mirror, Kittle ties his wide tie, combs his moustach His suit is of the finest, loudest plaid.  He straightens the "Whip Inflation Now" BUTTON on his wide lapel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle strides toward garages behind his building, pointi a remote.  One GARAGE DOOR OPENS slowly. We CANNOT SEE INTO the DARK GARAGE as Kittle disappears inside.  We HEAR a CAR DOOR.  An ENGINE ROARS, RUMBLES, idling... a throaty GURGLE... till Kittle pulls out in hi Ford Gran Torino GT... A small American flag on the antenna flaps in the breeze. The Torino swings onto the street, peeling out... ZOOM IN: as the Torino races away.  FREEZE FRAME. ...CREDIT SEQUENCE ENDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's Torino cruises down Vine past Capital Records. Traffic's light this early... WHIP PAN/ZOOM IN: on the "HOLLYWOOD" sign, distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids toss firecrackers in the gutter and watch them pop. Red, white and blue decorations are everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: SUPERIMPOSE TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: July 4th, 1976

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena walks down the sidewalk in a leather overcoat, sunglasses and ultra-flair bell-bottoms.  Shop-keepers raising storefront gates greet her.  Men crane their neck to watch her pass, wide-eyed and whistling. In the street, the Torino rounds a corner.  It pulls to t curb to meet Nena.  An elderly DRUNKARD's leering at Nena she climbs in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right on, Brown Sugar!  How 'bout taking me with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I'm going today, Old Man, you do not want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kittle pulls away, u-turning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfresco greasy-spoon.  Under one R,W+B umbrella, Billy-B in baggy suit and lollipop-orange aviator sunglasses, consumes a burger and looks lovey-eyed at his SCHOOL-MARM girlfriend, who reads a "MATH" text, innocent and petit. Across the street, Kittle's car pulls up, HONKING. Billy-Boy motions he'll be along in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Nena's reading "Fear of Flying."  Kittle watches Billy-Bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at her and him together.  King Kong and Fay Wray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena glances up, returns to reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy gives his girl an apple, kisses her.  Kittle la on the horn.  Billy-Boy runs over with a cup of take-out coffee, carrying a newspaper under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I always have to sit in back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the way things are, kiddo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I would like to sit in front today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fer cryin' out loud, Billy-Boy, just get in the car.  You're way too big a target to be sitting up here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy gets in, disgruntled, handing the coffee to Nen who passes it to Kittle as the car sets in motion. Billy-Boy turns to look out the back, waving goodbye. Kittle watches thru the rearview mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your precious little school-marm today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine, as if you cared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me something... what's a school teacher doing having you meet for breakfast in one of the filthiest parts of downtown skank-ville?  I mean, this is not the place for fine dining, unless looking at prostitutes stimulates your appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Filthy kids go to kindergarten too. What are you saying, anyhow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, I guess.  Just an observation.  She's really something special.  You're a lucky fella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lay off once, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the way you say it, like there's something more too it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You been wearing rubbers, Billy-Boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birth control's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blushing, astonished) What... what kinda thing is that to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's right.  If you two are doing the horizontal polka, the last thing you want is a thirty-five pound bundle-of-joy stumbling around, knocking over furniture and calling you "daddy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beleaguered) Jeez... it's too early in the morning for this.  Leave off. (hands up newspaper) Here's your paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, am I supposed to read it while I drive?  Keep a grip on it, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Billy-Boy) You know, the more weight back there, the faster the car goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never heard of physics, Einstein? The laws of physics.  The more ballast we keep closer to the rear tires...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm back here, aren't I?  So, you don't have to make up a buncha lies to make me feel good about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena faces front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino comes to halt at a seedy "ADULT BOOK SHOP." "Live Nude Girls."  Our heroes pile out of the car. Billy-Boy and Nena head in, but Kittle stops, incensed by GEORGE WASHINGTON MANNEQUIN with an inflatable SEX-DOLL i its arms.  A sign above reads "Porn on the Fourth of July Kittle shoves the mannequin to the ground, then follows..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle move briskly thru.  The PORN DEALER at the counter leaps to his feet, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, Kittle... I don't need no fucking hassle here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing, furious) Then, sit your fat, sweaty ass back down in that chair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Porn Dealer obeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle push through beaded curtains i a dank hall.  They split up, opening doors, searching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in thru a door) Pardon me... my mistake.  Taking your thoughts in hand, huh... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a booth) Whoops... don't mind me.  Go ahead and finish up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A greasy, bespectacled pervert, BENNY, sits in a tiny boo sweating in front of a window looking in on a top-less STRIPPER who gyrates without enthusiasm. A KNOCK, and Kittle sticks his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the management would like to offer a complimentary wet-nap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benny turns, mortified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Benny!  How's it hanging? Well... you know, don't answer that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle WHISTLES down the hall, then enters, friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you been hiding, grease-fist? We've been looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena and Billy-B cram in, shut the door.  Very tight fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember Nena and Billy-Boy. (BANGS on window) Take a break, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stripper goes to sit in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?  I'm clean.  I been clean a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?  Is that a fact... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle puts his gun to Benny's forehead, searches Benny's pockets, finding a bag of powder, which he hands over his shoulder to Nena.  Nena sticks in her pinkie, tastes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reholsters gun) You are such a disappointment, Benny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena sprinkles the powder to the floor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you fuckers!  You fucking fuckers!  What?  What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word is, while the vice cops on the East Coast were standing around playing pocket pool, 300 kilos of heroin got smuggled into New York City.  And, right now it's making a cross-country journey to Hollywood,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving tonight

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going into Zimmermann's pipeline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know how you guys operate, but I got a witness... (points to glass) I got a witness, so you can't squeeze me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bored stripper smokes a cigarette, and just then a ME DOOR SLIDES CLOSED over the window.  Peep show's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) Looks like your dime ran out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle motions to Billy-Boy.  Billy-Boy squeezes past, li Benny by the lapels and shakes him violently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey now... what the fuck... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy shakes Benny harder, really rattling him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what he's doing, Benny?  He's trying to jog your memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, man.  Even if I did, I'm not so crazy I'm gonna cross Zimmermann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This scag is enough to keep every junkie from here to the Mexican border high as a kite for the next two years.  You think we're gonna let Zimmermann haul it onto our streets on the Fourth-of-fucking-July!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must not think we take our responsibilities very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy shakes Benny, and shakes him and shakes him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last time Billy-Boy did this, the guy's neck broke... (SNAPS fingers) ... just like that.  Sad in a way. Why is it we don't truly appreciate our arms and legs till we've lost the use of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!  Alright... put me down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy looks to Kittle,  Kittle nods.  Billy-Boy puts Benny down.  Nena cozies up, starts combing Benny's hair over his bald spot, which is creeping him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bone dry out there.  Everybody's hurting.  The stuff floating around's been cut so many times it's like powdered sugar, but Zimnermann's gonna fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need the "when" and the "where."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, okay?  All I know is Butch Cassidy's back in town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what we heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back, swear to friggin' God.  I seen him at the needle farm saying how he's Zimmermann's number one candy-man again.  If anyone knows anything, he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Airight... we'll take that.  But, start spreading the news... (pokes Benny's chest) Zimmermann goes down tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena and Billy-Boy exit.  Benny's relieved.  Kittle stops and tosses a handful of coins on the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knock yourself out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle throws in a handkerchief, slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle get in the Torino.  They drive

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle Sorts thru 8-track tapes on the dash.  He puts one into the player and twists volume.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Springsteen's "BORN TO RUN" (or some similar 70's anthem cause all our hearts to skip a beat with cheap, easy, sentimental reminiscence) is HEARD KICKING IN... CAMERA FOLLOWS the Torino. TRACKING SHOT: of the stars on the dirty sidewalks of Hollywood Boulevard whizzing by. TRACKING SHOT: past a STREET VENDOR with a cart of flags, election buttons and dozens of R,W+B inflatable animals. WHIP PAN: to follow the Torino as it races past, then ZOOM IN: on the neon lettering of the "FROLIC ROOM" bar. TRACKING SHOT: past an x-rated theater double-billing "Al in Wonderland" and "Behind the Green Door." TRACKING SHOT: past a shop window of televisions all show Prez Ford speechifying. The Torino turns, cutting across a trash strewn lot. CAMERA FOLLOWS the Torino as it comes out to the street, the MUSIC spiriting us thru this montage abruptly goes GARBLED and SLOWS to an EXTENDED GROAN...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle looks down, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He yanks the 8-track cassette.  The player spits ragged tape.  It's screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torino's parked.  Nena looks through binoculars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Butch... show your pretty face...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH BINOCULARS
dialogues.text: Scanning curtained windows of a shit-hole MOTEL in bleak suburbs.  Various freaks and prostitutes hang out. Man-oh-man, this place is one hell of a skeeze-pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just breathing the air in there'll give you the clap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's still yanking tape from the cassette player, tossing it out.  Billy-Boy's smoking in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't litter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, concerned citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give a Hoot.  Don't Pollute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you a fucking hoot if you don't shut up back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle turns on the RADIO: "Afternoon Delight" by Starlig Vocal Band.  He pushes another button: "Saturday Night" b the Bay City Rollers. Billy-Boy takes a swig from his pocket flask, snuffs his cigarette in an overflowing ashtray. Kittle tries other stations, frustration growing as the choices worsen: "Disco Duck" by Rick Dees.  "Popcorn." "Seasons in the Sun" by Terry Jacks.  Glen Campbell's "Rhinestone Cowboy."  "Don't Give Up On Us" by David Soul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't torture yourself...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns the RADIO OFF, hands binoculars to Kittle and opens the newspaper.  Headline: ISRAELI COMMANDOS FREE HOSTAGES.  She pulls out a section, tossing it to Billy.. The funny pages.  Billy-Boy starts reading them. Nena folds the paper over to the "HOROSCOPE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you bother with that mumbo-jumbo crap?  Some fruitcake's writing it between bong hits, making it up as he goes, and you're actually taking the time to read it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, non-believer?  Here's yours... (reading) "Scorpio, October 24 to November 22: Jupiter is in conflict with Saturn, so proceed with caution..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!  Jupiter and Saturn'll get you every fucking time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Today you have a rare opportunity to make a big difference in your chosen field.  By your able leadership and with great conviction and strength of character, you will come up a winner."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that... (reads, impressed) Not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's pleased, looking back thru the binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's mine say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading, to Billy) "Leo.  The stages of the moon are in alignment, so now is a perfect time for a vigorous regimen of self improvement.  Wash yourself more carefully each morning, stop using pies and cakes as your primary source of nourishment, and quit tucking your shirttails inside your underwear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but it should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle lowers the binoculars, searching his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, before I forget...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands over two small boxes, wearing his sincerity on h sleeve.  Billy-Boy and Nena open the boxes, finding brigh R,W+B "Spirit of '76" SALT AND PEPPER SHAKERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pridefully modest) Just a little, you know... Bicentennial memento.  Nothing special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, thanks, man.  These are cool. They'll be collector's items.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unenthused) Yeah... great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... you could say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one with the star-spangled hard-on, not me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, communist?  At least numb-nuts here has the courtesy to pretend he likes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks back through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me for not ooing cartwheels over commemorative salt and pepper shakers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just think you should show some respect.  I mean, call me old fashioned, but 200 years ago when Ben Franklin and those guys signed the Constitution and Declaration of Independence, they did that so we could all share in the freedom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First of all, the Constitution wasn't writtem till 1787...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second of all, the Declaration of Independence was all for liberty and equality, but it didn't do anything about slavery, did it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stymied) Yeah, well... nobody's perfect.  They couldn't go doing everything at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, your little Bicentennial mementos would be more accurate if there were no holes in the pepper shaker so the pepper couldn't get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's drop it, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks back through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SEEDY MOTEL
dialogues.text: A hairy nan in only shorts gets a paper from a coin box. a balcony, a door opens... someone's coming out... ZOOM IN: on BUTCH CASSIDY, a sorry-looking transvestite hustler in blonde wig, smeared lipstick and cowboy hat. Butch Cassidy rides again.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle lowers binoculars.  Billy-Boy sits forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's go time, Billy-B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy climbs out, brings a GOLF CLUB as a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort everyone's favorite She-Male over here nice and peaceful-like. Let's not have another incident like at the laundromat.  I'll never forget the look on that poor woman's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it.  Just go.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy treks toward the motel. Up the block, Butch Cassidy greets other hookers in front the motel, slaps "five." Billy-Boy crosses the street, hides the club behind him. Ahead, a CUSTOMIZED VAN with a Spiderman mural painted on the side pulls up, stops across the street from the motel

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle frowns.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy picks up the pace.  Ahead, Butch Cassidy seems notice him, tries to act casual, heading to the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Don't let him get to the van.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Butch is going towards the van.  Billy-Boy starts run-walking, far from inconspicuous.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle grips the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him get to the van.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy looks to Billy-Boy, runs.  Billy-Boy sprint

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle leans out, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let him get to the fucking van!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy jumps in the van as it does a screaming u-turn.  Billy-Boy throws his golf club in frustration. Kittle starts the Torino and peels out just as the van ra past in the other direction. Billy-Boy runs back.  The Torino heads towards him, spins Nena throws open the door...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy scrambles in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth move, hot-shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose some weight.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino roars forward.  The van's got a good lead.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle hits the SIREN.  Nena mounts the spinning DOME LIG In back, Billy-Boy grips half his seatbelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't find my seatbelt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do about it?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The van zooms through an intersection, dipping hard.  A f beats later, the Torino follows, bouncing...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's head SLAMS roof.  He yelps, gripping his skul

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the high speed pursuit... Jerking corners. The van burns a 4-way stop.  A VW Bug starts to cross...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's looking down as he fastens his seatbelt. Nena points at the VW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle hits brakes...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino stops, inches from the Bug.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy lurches, hitting his face on the seat in front him and rebounding.  He clutches his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle pounds the horn.  Nena's yelling.  The Bug moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle zooms around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van takes a corner, careening off a parked car... The van races on.  However, ahead... A car backs out of a driveway, blocking the street. The van brakes hard, throwing smoke, HORN BLARING. Behind, the Torino rounds the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Go, go, go!"  "Slow down."  Make up your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't crowd him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino closes in.  The van's rear doors open... ZOOM IN: a tie-dyed HIPPY in the van leveling a SHOTGUN.. In the Torino, Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy see him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, Mama and Billy-Boy duck as the Torino brakes. The hippy BLASTS... A hole EXPLODES in the Torino's windshield. The Torino stops.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy sit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hate to say I told you so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van's reverse lights come on, tires spinning... Kittle reacts, puts the Torino in reverse... The van picks up speed, doors jerking closed, chasing the Torino backwards down the block... Nena kicks hard -- jettisons the ruined windshield.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: The VAN DRIVER uses the side rearview to see.  Butch Cassidy, in the passenger seat, looks to the back where t Hippy's kneeled on a WATERBED and reloading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you doin'?  They're pigs!  You can't kill no cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch me.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Kittle's going full speed reverse.  Nena FIRES her gun in the back of the van. Other cars brake as the Torino rockets backwards thru an intersection.  The van arrives similarly, sliding... The van burns rubber, chooses another street, forward.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Nena reloads with a speed loader.  Kittle shifts gear, blasting onwards to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sons of bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We catch 'em, I wanna be first to hurt 'em.  Promise me I get to go first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll share.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van hits the road's crest, airborne... Lands hard, heading downhill, south into a canyon. The Torino follows, flying... bottoming out. The road twists radically.  Kittle brings the Torino close... nudges the van's rear. The van SCRAPES guardrail, throws sparks, straightens.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Wind whips thru the car.  Nena gets onto the hood, halfwa out, biting her lip and aiming two guns,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your horses, sweetpea.  We need Butch Cassidy alive, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena considers, disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they crash, maybe he'll run.  You can shoot him in the leg or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hope.

dialogues.speaker: ON CANYON ROAD
dialogues.text: The van and Torino barrel downhill, barely controlled. Opposing traffic zips past. Kittle rams from behind again.  The van's doors open... The Hippy tries to aim, shifting to and fro. The Torino backs off.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE VAN
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy gets out of his seat, moves back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crazy fucking junkie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch KICKS the Hippy from behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hippy hits the street, rolls... Screaming as... The Torino's grillwork rushes to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TORINO
dialogues.text: The car BOUNCES -- BUMPITY-THUD -- as the Hippy is crushe Billy-Boy looks back as the body disappears around a bend

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy unhooks the POLICE RADIO microphone beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Central, car 1-5-5 requests an ambulance (looks back) Uh... ambulance emergency at Canyon Boulevard and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to spot a cross street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic, at a loss) Um... we're on Canyon where it's really... twisty, turny.

dialogues.speaker: ON CANYON ROAD
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the van and Torino.  The road's curves are extreme It's all the Torino can do to stay close. Taking a turn wide, the van DECIMATES mailboxes. The Torino follows through fluttering letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a federal offense right there; tampering with the U.S  mail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle girds his loins, eyeing the opposite lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (worried) No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (equally fearful) That's a bad plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle loosens his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get beside.  Nena, you're gonna shoot out his tires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we are not going to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle accelerates.  ENGINE ROARS...

dialogues.speaker: ON CANYON ROAD
dialogues.text: The Torino inches into the opposite lane, is forced to retreat because of oncoming traffic. The Torino tries again, but a pick-up truck's coming... Misses by inches, side mirror SMASHED!  Kittle recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (determined) I can work this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: ON CANYON ROAD
dialogues.text: Brief straightaway.  Kittle speeds up... The Torino comes along the van's left side... Nena puts her guns out, aiming for tire... AHEAD:  a motorcycle speeding straight at the Torino!

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle's eyes widen. Nena sees the cycle. Kittle jerks the wheel left. Nena pulls her arms in just as...

dialogues.speaker: ON CANYON ROAD
dialogues.text: The motorcycle somehow fits between the van and Torino. The Torino returns to its proper lane behind the van.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Nena looks at Kittle, seething.  Kittle won't look at her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... SUCK!  You almost got us all killed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is so easy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be worse than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, white bread.  Give it up.  Right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay... hold on.  Don't go getting your panties in a knot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle peers forward, THRU WINDSHIELD: pretty straight ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make a hole, Billy-Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather you guys didn't do this again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy reluctantly slides behind Nena as she reaches t hold the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simultaneously: Kittle scrambles over the front seat to t back and Nena hops into the driver's seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're taking a ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shifts, ENGINE GROWLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Store fronts and businesses.  The van takes a corner, dod other cars... The Torino pursues, Nena at the wheel. The van faces a mini-traffic jam.  Nowhere to go, except. Up on the sidewalk, CLOBBERING a parking meter. Nena follows without hesitation, jumps the curb. On the sidewalk, PEDESTRIANS scatter, screaming. The van BLASTS through the obligatory NEWSSTAND... Up ahead: FRUIT STAND... DESTROYED... The van hits the cross street... BOUNCES over a median strip, burning rubber.  The Torino's behind, HORN BLOWING Civilian vehicles panic skid, CRASHING parked cars, The upcoming intersection shows a red light.  Too bad.  T van SLAMS a crossing car, exploding onward.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle climbs up to the front passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get closer!  Don't lose him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kinda already figured that, but keep those helpful hints coming.

dialogues.speaker: ON A CROSS STREET
dialogues.text: The van takes a sharp turn, tooling up a HIGHWAY ON-RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... onto the freeway.  Relatively clear sailing ahead.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy looks in his rearview. THROUGH MIRROR: the Torino rises on the horizon.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: It's all R.P.M.'s here.  80mph... 85mph and climbing. The Torino's closing the gap.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy climbs across the waterbed, opening a utili box by the wheel-well... finds the van's JACK.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino zig-zags past other cars.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: The world outside's a blur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (motions with hands) You put your bumper just behind his left tire and then accelerate... make him spin out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there nothing in this world you enjoy more than the sound of your own voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back, Billy-Boy's looking out, sweaty scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) This is too fast. (to Kittle and Nena) This is way too fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grips Kittle's shoulder) We should slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands off the suit, monkey-boy. Close your eyes if you're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy sits back, digs up his "Pittsburgh Steelers" football helmet and straps it on.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The van and Torino blast past.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy's at the head of the waterbed with the jack rigged under the frame, pumping the handle... The frame lifts in front; angled so the waterbed's slidin and sloshing... bunching up at the rear doors.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino increases velocity.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy locks the jack, climbs over the frame and slides down, stomping on the blob-like waterbed. He grips a strap on the ceiling and kicks at the rear doo handle, but misses.  Kicks again.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino's directly behind.  The van's doors open...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Nena, Kittle and Billy-Boy see what's about to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The waterbed flops out on tbe road... The Torino COLLIDES in an EXPLOSION OF WATER... Spins out of control... Skids backwards on the shoulder, scraping the guardwall t it finally comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Dazed pause.  Nena, Kittle and Billy-Boy are drenched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... you had your chance, sister.  Make room for Kittle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena climbs in back.  Kittle takes the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino spits shoulder gravel, u-turning... causing ot cars to make drastic moves to avoid.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle accelerates, shifting gear, focused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time has come... (shifts gear) ... for asses to be kicked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shifts again.  ENGINE DEAFENING... SPEEDOMETER: 65mph... 70mph... 75mph...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: FAR AHEAD: the van.  Butch Cassidy sticks his head out th window, holds his hat, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed.  The Torino's far back, but coming on strong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Firepower, Billy-Boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy swigs from his flask.  He opens a trap door in seat beside him, reaching back in the trunk to produce a sawed-off shotgun, which he hands up to Nena. SPEEDOMETER: vibrating at 99mph... 105mph...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino's getting close to the van, looks like it's go pass on the right.  The van moves to block... Kittle twists the wheel... Coming around the van's left side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena points the shotgun... The Torino overtakes the van... Nena fires -- BOOM -- the van's back tire is OBLITERATED! The van fishtails, out of control... The van crosses six lanes left, then crosses right back, straight at the concrete GUARDWALL... CRASHES into the guardwall -- the van driver flies throug the windshield like a human cannonball, thrown off the elevated highway...

dialogues.speaker: ON A SURFACE STREET BELOW
dialogues.text: A TRUCK DRIVER sits in traffic, whistles a tune. PULL BACK to REVEAL: he's in a GLASS TRUCK loaded down wi great, big, perfect sheets of glass, just as... The van driver soars from above -- SHATTERING EVERYTHING!

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE HIGHWAY
dialogues.text: The Torino skids to halt on the shoulder. Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy run back to look down to where people gather around the glass accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jiminy Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can not even begin to imagine how much that must have hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the van, a door opens and Butch Cassidy stumbles out, askew, bleeding.  He runs across the highway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees Butch) You got to be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena whips out a gun, FIRES a warning shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halt, jackass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch keeps going.  Nema takes quick aim, SHOOTS... Butch's leg is knocked out from under him.  He hits the median, moaning.  Cars rush past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nena) Told you you'd get to shoot him. (heads to car, to Billy-Boy) Think you can pick him up without all the bells and whistles this time, Big-Boy?  Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wounded Torino rides up at the precinct house. At the underground garage, JOE MECHANIC, in greasy overal jaws with cops.  He spots the Torino coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, Jeez, here we go again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Joe.  These things happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle gets out.  Nena and Billy-Boy drag out the battere Butch Cassidy in a gag and handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tosses keys) Pop in a windshield and bang out the dents.  I need it quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets in Torino) This car loves you, Kittle.  Why do you treat it so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear of commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe drives the Torino into the underground garage. Billy-Boy and Nena bring Butch Cassidy up the precinct ho stairs.  Kittle follows,  Cops come and go.  FRIEND COP comes out, a young, fresh-faced model citizen in uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's elated to see Friend Cop, bear-hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, squirt!  Goddamn, it's good to see you.  How you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't complain, but I will if you give me half a chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You met my partners... ? (to Nena and Billy-B) This here's Harry McDoogle's kid. Fresh out of the academy.  Top of the class and best scores on the pistol range to boot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy and Nena greet him and shake hands.  Meanwhile.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE BLOCK
dialogues.text: A CADILLAC Eldorado rounds the corner.  TWO VILLAINS in front.  ONE VILLAIN in back.  All in suits and ski-masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (positively beaming) Your pop must be proud of you.  Look at ya, ya short-shaver...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle takes off Friend Cop's hat, ruffles his crew-cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally got a haircut.  Hell, you look almost respectable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Almost, right? (of Butch Cassidy) Looks like you got your hands full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buckaroo's going downstairs for a little "chit-chat."  Gonna tell us all about Zimmermann's big score... (removes Butch's gag) Aren't you, Butch-Butch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stuffs gag back) He's disgruntled right now, but he'll come around.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Cadillac speeds up... SPLIT-SCREEN:

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRS, (SLO-MO)
dialogues.text: Nena sees danger, shouts           MACHINE GUNS point fro a warning...                                the windows o Friend Cop spots the                  The Ski-masked VILL Cadillac and starts to                open fire -- flame draw his gun...                          from their weapo Billy-Boy dives forward...         and BLASTING and BLAST Butch Cassidy's hit... blood exploding from his           VILLAINS keep FIRING, body and splattering...            bared through their ma Billy-Boy tackles Kittle...        Machine guns retorting Nena hits the dirt.                   gun barrels spittin Friend Cop's gun is only           BLASTING... halfway up when bullets            BLASTING... slap him in the chest and          BLASTING... BLOOD spurts!  (Straight-          BLASTING... from-the-bucket red paint          BLASTING... blood, like all 70's blood.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy lands on the                BLASTING ceaselessl ground with Kittle in his arms.                                   The Cadillac Butch Cassidy does a dance of death as glass doors            Machine guns are withd behind him SHATTER.                   smoke wafting. SPLIT-SCREEN ENDS as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Butch Cassidy goes flying thru the precinct doors. Friend Cops falls, coughing blood. Billy-Boy leaps to his feet, enraged... Nena rises to follow... Billy-Boy and Nena draw weapons as they bound down the stairs, chasing the Cadillac, SHOOTING. On the stairs, Kittle sees Friend Cop down.  Horror. Billy-Boy and Nena keep running and FIRING, but... The Cadillac escapes round a corner. Kittle comes to Friend Cop's body, cradles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... come on, kid.  Come on... (feels for pulse) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friend Cop's dead.  Kittle squeezes him, eyes filling wit tears, anguished fury building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the heavens) Noooooooooooo...!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the Cadillac's escape.  Villains remove ski-masks.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: In front, there's MICKEY, evil, with spiked blonde hair a wrap-around sunglasses, and BALLS, eviller, a lip-less dullard in a fez hat and turtle-neck sweater.  In back, there's POE, evilest, one dangerous-looking bastard; a circus freak giant in a pink polyester three-piece suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job, boys.  Iced a bonus cop in the bargain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dips his gold-plated pinkie-nail in a vial, snorts cok

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Groovey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grins, has a bunch of teeth missing in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Windowless, wood-paneled walls showcase fine oil painting QUIET MUSIC PLAYS.  It's a staid club, isolated from the outside world.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy push thru the front doors, blowing by the MAITRE D'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're excused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy stop, scanning the restaurant. The maitre d' catches up, blocking, calmly superior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sirs and madam... I assure you you're not welcome here,  This is a very exclusive, private club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So is this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle shows his badge, moving on... Snobby, upper-crusty PATRONS look up with disapproval fro their R,W+B centerpieced tables as our heroes stride to.. The table in the rear corner, where ZIMMERMANN is flanked TWO BIMBOS, Mickey, Balls, Poe and other THUGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well... if it isn't the Justice League of America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann is a jewelry-adorned, Truman Capote-ish drug-czar, sinister and calm.  Balls stands, looking toug Billy-Boy picks up speed, SHOVES Balls with both hands... Sends Balls stumbling violently backwards, CRASHING into FLIPPING over another table, to the dismay of patrons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Balls) Don't get up on our account. (to Zimmermann) Mind if we join you, Zimmermann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle sits.  Thugs are edgy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my guest. (to bimbos) Ladies... go powder your beaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bimbos go as Nena and Billy-Boy sit.  Balls rises, wiping scrambled eggs off his suit, furious.  Zimmermann waves him off, and Balls acquiesces, skulking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you been, Poe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than ever, chickie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still haven't fixed those front choppers, huh?  Guess you're digging that hillbilly look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We probably should give 'em back... but Billy-Boy seems to think they're some kinda good luck charm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy holds up a tiny jar with teeth inside, rattles them at Poe.  Poe remains impassive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still eatimg) What can we do for you, officers? What new, mindless harassments have you planned this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted to make you aware... before today's over, we'll be standing on top of your mountain of horse and pissing down on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for sharing that charming image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laugh it up.  You'll cry later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll cry like a great big, blubbering baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann laughs, dabs his mouth with his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You three... (shakes head, amazed, addresses the table) Narcotics have been around since before 4000 B.C.  Marijuana was a major crop in colonial North America. Wars have been waged over opium, and still... in spite of it... (motions to trio) ... into that timeline of thousands of years come three vice cops determined to change the course of human history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thugs laugh derisively.  Kittle struggles to mask anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Couldn't have said it better myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bust some small-time pimps, whores and dime-bag junkies, like the world's a better place because you're in it.  And for what, Kittle... two hundred and fifty dollars a week? Tell me, how does anyone get so self-rightious when they can barely afford to pay their rent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just 'cause you belong to some fancy-pants club, doesn't make you any less a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murderer?  Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're stealing people's lives, pusher-man. You might be killin' them so slow they think they're being saved, but down that road, they're just as dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Live under whichever delusion you choose, you'll never touch me. You're not smart enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shove it up your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And always with the witty rejoinder. Touche'! (picks up menu) Let me treat you to brunch.  You'll need your strength.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but we don't recognize "brunch" as an actual meal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at menu) I insist.  What will it be?  Boston Tea Party Clam Chowder, or maybe the Chicken Red, White and Cordon Bleu? No... (tosses menu) There's a special on the menu, today only... (pointedly, to Kittle) ... roasted pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle does a slow boil...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Friend Cop's gun is only halfway up when bullets slap him the chest and BLOOD spurts... !

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE IN POSE CLUB
dialogues.text: All at once, IN SLOW MOTION: Kittle stands, enraged, pulling his gun... Poe pulls his gun... Nena shoves her hands in her overcoat pockets... Billy-Boy reaches both hands cross-armed into his jacket. Kittle levels his gun at Zimmermann. Poe puts his gun to Kittle's temple. Billy-Boy points two guns at Mickey just as Mickey raises his gun and puts it in Billy-Boy's face. Nena brings her hands thru pocket holes, shrugging her co pointing two sawed-off shotguns on shoulder straps. Several thugs freeze, eye-to-eye with Nena's shotguns. END SLO-MO.  Stalemate.  Waiters and patrons freak, clear out, screaming.  The eye of the storm:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could end a whole lotta suffering right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your friends' lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann calmly stares down Kittle's gun, brings a fork of meat to his south and chews.  Kittle wants to pull the trigger so badly, shaking, sweat dripping down his face. But, Kittle reins his anger in...  backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your poison's not gonna make it into the veins of any kids this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wave that flag, hero.  Keep dreaming those dreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle leads Nena and Billy-Boy out, past frightened employees.  Thugs return to their seats. SLOW ZOOM IN: as Zimmermann allows an edge of anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something needs to be done about them, once and for all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The precinct's busy with cops and jabbering weirdoes in custody.   Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy move thru the boarded-over front doors, crossing... All around, other cops are giving dirty looks to our trio Near the duty desk, OFFICER STEVE, a square-jawed uniform cop, nudges his intense, crew-cut partner, OFFICER JIM. These are blue-blooded, boots-polished, buttons-shined co Officer Steve points out Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with disdain) Whoop-de-do, there they go. Strutting in like they're better than us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a disgrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's their kind of... of... overzealous antics that give cops a bad name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Steve nods in full agreement. Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy near double doors.  A grumpy-looking plain-clothes HOMICIDE COP is heading the opposite direction, chomping on a peanut-butter and jelly sandwich.  His eyes light up when he spots Billy-Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouth full, to Billy) Hey, big man... how's the last of the red hot lovers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's confused.  Homicide Cop's jolly, like they're on a private joke.  Problem is, Billy-Boy's not in on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off Billy-B's confusion) That girlie of yours... she's one-in-a-million, I'll tell you.  How you lucked into that, I'll never know.  You must be one gifted cocksman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't... what... !??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, Homicide Cop's beading on, winking and clicking his tongue in lascivious appreciation.  Billy-Boy hasn't a cl moving to keep up with Nena and Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stereotypically busy room of overburdened bulletin boar and file cabinets.  As Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy enter, WHIP PAN: to middle-aged CAPT. ALBERT, who points angrily

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My office!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert slams the door, circles Kittle, Nena and Billy-B as they sit.  The graying DISTRICT ATTORNEY RAVIC stands with arms crossed, looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I turned on my t.v., and I expected to see Los Angeles brimming with jubilation.  I expected children with painted faces.  Men and women in Bicentennial garb.  Multi-ethnic marching bands.  Pie eating contests. All good things American. I turned on my t.v., and what did I see instead? (turns to cops) A corpse was scraped off Canyon Road after Lord knows how many cars ran over the carcass.  And in a related story, a high speed chase ended when the suspect was thrown from the highway to his death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy exchange looks, a bit sheepish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, what... what am I forgetting? Oh, yes... the transvestite junkie whose bullet riddled body came blasting through the front doors of the precinct house!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Don't open your mouth!  You honestly think you can explain this to my satisfaction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I think I can... clarify...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother.  This behavior's gone on too long.  You're suspended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert points at a CLOCK.  12 noon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's noon straight up.  Effective immediately, you three work desk jobs till midnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been chasing this deal six months, and now you're gonna chuck it out the window?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW ZOOM IN: on Kittle as he stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey now, look!  Let's all get on the same page here.  This shipment is do or die for Zimmermann's syndicate; all or nothing.  If we stop the drugs, we don't even have to catch him red-handed.  He's ruined cause his pushers go broke with nothing to sell.  On the other hand, if we fuck this up, it means more zombies crawling the gutters than ever and a morgue that doesn't have a single empty drawer.  More old ladies getting mugged and molested by junk-hungry needle-freaks, and all the while Zimmermann's sitting back and laughing his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There'll be other chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not like this.  Are you even listening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not allow your obsession to turn a day of pride and celebration into a day of wholesale slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) May I say something... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy sits back down.  Kittle's fed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you condescend to tell me how or why to honor Independence Day, and don't tell me I'm overreacting when I'm trying to bust the guy responsible for half the filthy junk coming into this city!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're about an inch away from insubordination!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... seeing how you just suspended me, what's to stop me from calling you a crazy bastard, you old fart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bottled fury) Till the last firework fizzles out tonight, detective, you sit a desk. And, after that, I'll decide if you keep your shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy storm in.  Cops at sinks and urinals look up.  Kittle motions them out. Nena goes to sit on the window ledge, worried, while Billy-Boy checks stalls.  The other cops exit, irritated,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say, fuck 'em.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... we shouldn't rush into this, right?  Let's talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, Henry friggin' Kissinger all the sudden?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just saying nothing!  Tonight is the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but if we don't sit, they'll take our badges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What of it?  Haven't we waited forever... ? (turns to Nena) Haven't we, honey?  Haven't we waited long enough to get this scumbag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena looks down.  She's having doubts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?  Not you too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right.  We hit the bricks, we walk back triple-fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm hearing this,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked my ass off for my badge, Kittle,  It's the only thing that makes me different from every other slob out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is, even if you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I got is being a cop.  What do I do if I'm not that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You big, fat sonofabitch, if it weren't for me, you'd still be sitting in the file room where I found you. (to Nena) And you... Nena... you've still got needle scars from where I pulled you out of.  You of all people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my arms healed up real good, and that's how I wanna keep 'em. That's what I'm trying to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys... all we've got is each other. Don't we know that by now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena stews.  Billy-Boy sweats, stares at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ... (hurt pause) Alright... alright, I'm taking off. I'll expect you to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks.  The door swings closed.  Nena's miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Damn him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE TORINO, Kittle gets in.  He keys the engine, pause gripping the wheel, contemplating.  It's something we've seen cross Kittle's face till now: uncertainty.  Worry. Kittle faces front and shakes off doubt, cursing himself. He puts the car in gear and peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino va-roooms past...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle broods, turns the RADIO ON.  "Muskrat Love" by Captain and Tennille.  He changes channels, irritated: "Convoy."  "The Streak."  "Welcome Back" by John Sebastia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) Come on, come on... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "The Hustle."  "Run, Joey, Run" by David Geddes.  "Kung F Fighting."  He turns the RADIO OFF, sickened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino parks.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle gets a bottle of baby powder from the glove compartment.  He takes a section of newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: ON HOLLYWOOD BOULEVARD
dialogues.text: Kittle walks briskly.  Every flea-ridden business along t way's drumming up business by exhibiting patriotism.  Kit stops, hesitating... backtracks... At the XXX-THEATER, he examines a poster for "DEEP ASS," which shows a half-naked, "Deep Ass" ingenue in blue eye shadow, pig-tails and moist lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy Sits eating a burger, staring lovey-eyed at his SCHOOL-MARM girlfriend.  The girlfriend's familiar now...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE AT XXX-THEATER
dialogues.text: The "school-marm" is the porn star on the poster.  Kittle realizes, saddened.  He KICKS -- SHATTERS the window.  Th THEATER OWNER rushes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you fucking creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle shoves his badge in the owners face.  The owner ba off.  Kittle takes the "Deep Ass" poster... He folds it and pockets it as he continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seedy.  DISCO MUSIC THROBS.  Kittle passes through the turnstile.  By the erratic light of a glitter ball, three topless, body-painted women, RED GO-GO DANCER, WHITE GO-G DANCER and BLUE GO-GO DANCER, grind to disco rhythm. Kittle moves, wading thru drunken vermin.  A few BUSINESS MEN dance woozily in the aisle.             At the bar, PINKEYE, a sizable lunatic-thug wearing a knitted macrame tie and brown corduroy leisure suit, watc Kittle cross.  Pinkeye downs his scotch. Kittle moves against one curtained wall, admiring the nearest go-go dancer.  He slips behind the curtain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle moves quickly down this hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle climbs a long staircase.  He takes out the bottle baby powder, sprinkles powder on the top landing. He unfolds his newspaper and places it flat over the powd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet POP-SWEET, black super-pimp in lime-green fuzzy jump-suit and feathered fedora. He's on the couch, on the phone, caressing the HOOKER bes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Get this straight, you jive-ass cocksucker.  Do a number on me and you are between a rock and a hard place.  Dig it, clown?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet hangs up, grumbling as he crosses the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucker thinks he can play me for a fool.  I'm a entrepreneur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure are, sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, bitch.  Don't be Ed McMahonning me every time I open my mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet sits at his desk.  TWO PROSTITUTES wait there. One buffs his nails.  The other gives a backrub. The door flies open.  It's Kittle, moving forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet reaches in a desk drawer... Kittle comes to SLAM the drawer on Pop-Sweet's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooow!... alright, man, ease off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle lets Pop-Sweet's hand free, removes the drawer and retrieves a pearl-handled gun, which he admires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always did have style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his wrist) It's one of a kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So are you, Pop-Sweet.  That's why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREAM of RAGE is HEARD.  Kittle wheels... The Hooker's charging, swinging a straight razor... Kittl lifts the drawer to block, then PUNCHES... The Hooker hits shelves of vases, which crash down on her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, Kittle... why you got to go doin' that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet goes to the unconscious Hooker, rolls her away favor of broken pottery, which he fingers forlornly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of the vase) This shit was Ming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the problem with expensive tastes... the more you got, the more you got to lose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle sits.  Pop-Sweet rises, studies Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your pet gorilla and the female Uncle Tom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly off guard) They're... around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?  So, what do you want to ask today that I can't answer?  I'm a busy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way Zimmermann takes such good care of you and this drug-peddling "escort service" of yours, I figure you got the scoop on the pharmaceuticals arriving tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deep sigh, nods) Well, let me tell you how it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet bolts, out the door,  Kittle stands, in no hurr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet runs down the hall, heading for stairs.  He hit the newspaper and baby powder, slipping, flying... TUMBLES painfully down the stairwell... Hits bottom and lays there, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... son of a bitch... broke my fucking arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle strolls to catch up, starts downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna cut off your flippin' head and use it for a candy dish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle steps on Pop-sweet's cbest, leans in close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk like that, I might forget to call an ambulance.  Now, tell me again, how's the dope arriving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CREAK is HEARD behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes) Fuck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Kittle turns, he's grabbed from behind and thrown He hits a wall and lands in a heap, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the one gonna be needing an ambulance, white boy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkeye's upon Kittle, stripping him of his gun.  Another brute, LORD CAVIAR, in an open-to-the-belly silk shirt an with jeweled rings on every finger, helps Pop-Sweet up. Kittle tries to get up.  Pinkeye PUNCHES him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Pinkeye) Outside.
Red Go-Go Dancer shakes her bootie to the DISCO BEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A metal door swings open as Kittle's thrown out into a pi of garbage.  Pinkeye, Lord Caviar and Pop-Sweet follow... SLO-MO: Pinkeye punches Kittle again. SLO-MO: Lord Caviar comes to pistol whip Kittle's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White Go-Go Dancer moves her hands across her body, sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO:  Kittle's bleeding bad, tries to rise, gets KICKE SLO-MO:  Pop-Sweet, clutching his arm, watches with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue Go-Go Dancer's breasts sway as she dances.  She smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO:  Kittle's thrown, clattering thru trash cans. SLO-MO:  Lord Caviar kicks Kittle's ribs. SLO-MO:  Kittle lifts his head, bloody, looking... DOWN THE ALLEY: Nena and Billy-Boy running this way! For a moment, Kittle smiles crooked.  He's saved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) ... Nena... Billy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet looks down the same alley... It's empty.  Nena and Billy-Boy were Kittle's delusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you talkin' too, Kittle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet whacks Kittle with a backhanded SLAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ain't there, turkey.  You're all by your lonesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AERIAL SHOT (FROM ADJACENT ROOFTOP): looking down as the beating continues.   POP-SWEET'S LAUGHTER is HEARD POORLY DUBBED OVER and OUT OF SYNC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena's miserable, wearing big headphones plugged into a "portable" cassette recorder, pulling files, tossing them Into the box on Billy-Boy's lap.  He smokes, staring off, deeply depressed.  Captain Albert arrives to slap his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop day-dreaming, lard ass.  Where's Kittle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena takes off her headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to pick up lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shake a leg.  Get these files downstairs... (to Nena) And, quit listening to your fucking voodoo music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic, salutes) Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the captain moves on, Nena makes her salute into the finger.  She and Billy-Boy share a long look of mutual frustration, then Billy-Boy shuffles away. Nena puts headphones back on, ejects a tape from her recorder and replaces it with another. INT.  PRECINCT, CAPTAIN'S OFFICE -- INTERCUT... Captain Albert sits.  PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, what is it? (from phone) Is your telephone etiquette always so sloppy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert tenses, goes to shut his door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous, into phone) Why the hell are you calling me here?

dialogues.speaker: INTERCUT
dialogues.text: Beyond a gate topped by an ornate "Z," a pseudo-modern, stucco-nightmare palace sits in H'wood hills. Calmly, captain.  If it weren't important, I wouldn't disturb the fine work you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party preparations.  Men chisel a bald eagle ice sculptur Thugs lounge on Ethan Allen furnishings.  Zimmermann stan with the phone held to his ear by his ENGLISH BUTLER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Your children played with their guns in front of me again today.  This upsets me. (from phone) They've been suspended.  Hell, the do-gooder district attorney came and did it himself.  Thinks he's being a patriot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suspending those three is about as useful as giving a speeding ticket to Evil Knievel. I'm keeping an eye on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I've had my fill.  I want them taken out of the game. Hello?!  Still on the line? Yeah... I hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert wipes his sweaty brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What you're asking... goes against every code of honor... (from phone) Isn't it a bit late to regret lost innocence?  We don't want any indiscreet photographs ending up in the hands of your wife, do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert agonizes, reddening, trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, into phone) I can... make certain arrangements. But, it'll cost extra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Name your price. (from phone) I want those pictures.  The negatives... everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pluck this thorn from my paw, and you'll have them, with my gratitude. (bitterly) Just the pictures'll be fine, you dirty bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann exits, motioning for the butler to hang up. Behind, workmen on ladders unfurl a gigantic American fla from ceiling to floor.  Breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: INT, ZIMMERMANN'S MANSION, FOYER
dialogues.text: A meek music instructor, VINCHENZO, waits with sheet musi under his arm, studying a painting.  Zimmermann strides i his mood brightening,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vinchenzo... forgive me for letting business trifles distract my attention.  On to more important pursuits, eh?  Come, come... I have a surprise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann ushers the always nervous Vinchenzo forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann's hands open a medium-sized wooden packing cra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It arrived today.  You won't believe it, even when you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in a room that's like a bad family-theme-restaura version of a 18th century European music parlor.  Gaudy. Big harp in a corner.  Zimmermann digs thru shredded pape in the crate, removing an old violin case. Vinchenzo is taken aback as Zimmermann opens the case, an gently takes out a beautiful VIOLIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with reverence) Stradivarius.  Antonius Stradivarius of Cremona, post seventeen hundred. One of perhaps five hundred and forty.  Absolutely priceless. (studies it) I was born in Newark, New Jersey, Vinchenzo, as far away from this moment as I think you could ever get. My family lived each day in poverty. I wasn't expected to make anything of myself.  Failure was a given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann lets Vinchenzo hold the violin,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These hands... (holds his hands up) These are the hands of a grocery clerk... of a janitor, and then a numbers runner who fought and clawed and battled, by hook or by crook, to get his piece of the American dream. These hands were not destined to caress a Stradivarius,  And yet... (takes violin back) The impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann picks up his bow off a music stand.  Vinchenzo takes this as his cue, moving obediently to place music o the stand in front of Zimmermann. With a flourish, Zimmermann puts the Stradivarius under h chin, tilts his head, puts the how to the violin strings. pause, and then... Zlmmermann proceeds to play horribly.  Screechy and uneven.  He tries to follow the sheet music, but a child could do better. Vinchenzo attempts to guide by motioning with his hands a body language, cringing a bit, trying to encourage. Zimmermann's frustrated, but keeps playing, vomitously ba biting his tongue in concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his small, office bathroom, Captain Albert splashes hi face with water.  He stares in the mirror, pale and fearf

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert returns to his office from the adjoining bathroom.  He goes to a cabinet.  He unlocks a drawer and takes out a paper bag hidden far back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy topples boxes of files.  He bends to pick up th mess.  Nena enters, eyeing Billy-Boy's ass.  She kicks it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the... ?!  What was that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking out) Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (follows, rubbing ass) How come everyone thinks hitting me's the best way to get my attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
