dialogues.text: Nena moves thru, looking around.  Billy-Boy trails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to find Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena ducks behind a squad car.  She gets in and yanks wir under the dash, hot wiring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  But, what changed our mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sparking wires) Just keep an eye out till I get this rig up and running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy rises to keep watch.  His eyes narrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... he's back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the garage, Kittle's Torino is moving thru. Billy-Boy and Nena move to follow. The Torino parks... the door opens... Kittle gets out, beaten bloody, barely supporting himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle collapses to the ground. Billy-Boy and Nena run to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stairwell door slams open and Billy-Boy charges upsta with Kittle semi-conscious in his arms.  Nena follows. ABOVE, Captain Albert comes to watch, keeping hidden till they're gone, then he starts downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's lying on the floor in Nena's lap, swollen-faced bruised.  Nena uses a needle to sew inside his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nohody's fault but mine.  I got blindsided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's pacing, frustrated, sad, infuriated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shoulda been there to back you up. We shoulda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop blaming yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena makes a stitch.  Kittle's lip is pulled by the threa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's broke.  Keep sewing. (drinks from flask) And quit pacing, you big ox.  You're making me skittish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy SMASHES a mirror with his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill 'em...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking to vent, he grips a sink, jerking it furiously, starting to pull it from the wall, water spurting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!  Fuck everything!  God damn sons of bitching mother humpers... I'm gonna rip'em all brand new assholes... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... HEY!    Cool down, Jumbo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy snaps out of it, looks to Nena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going out.  But, here's the situation, and here's how it's gonna go down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop at the evidence cage window sigus papers for the GU inside.  The cop finishes, says goodbye.  Kittle arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, what the hell?  You look like shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle points his gun at the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, man... I was only kidding... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlock the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can't do that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!  Unless you want your head to make a whistling sound on windy days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard nods, moving back.  He opens a door,  Billy-Boy and Nena enter with duffel bags, guns up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uniformed cops pass.  Captain Albert rises from behind a patrol car, sneaking... At the Torino, he takes out the paper bag, unwraps a smal plastic-explosive CAR BOMB and hand-held DETONATOR. UNDER THE TORINO, Captain Albert crawls to the gas tank. attaches the car bomb with a magnetic THUNK. He unfolds the detonator antenna, flicks a switch.  A GRE light LIGHTS UP.  A GREEN light also LIGHTS UP on the bom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's just finishing wrapping the guard in duct tap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Nena, at tall shelves full of confiscated WEAPONS, load guns and ammo into duffel bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any preferences?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever goes bang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep stuffing bags.  Billy-Boy arrives to help, nervous, filling a suitcase with shotguns and shells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we're stealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not stealing.  We're borrowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're stealing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the police lock-up.  We're police.  How can we steal from ourselves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, why'd we tie him up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're stealing, okay!  Quit yackin' and do it faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle flips open a box.  His eyes brighten with exciteme

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ay Dios mio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a box of DYNAMITE.  Kittle caresses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weapons are piled into the Torino's trunk.  The trunk is slammed shut.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy look to make su no one's taken undue notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So far so good.  We're past the point of no return.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks for support, holds out his hand.   Nena grip his hand... Billy-Boy joins in; like teammates clasping hands in a football huddle, gathering courage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this thing done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All for one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and fuck 'em all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert stands looking out the window, nervous. Must be your lucky day, cap'n...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain turns.  Kittle enters with a shoebox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna put a great big, ear-to-fucking-ear smile on your face.  How 'bout that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.  That's all that counts. Watch... you'll enjoy this... it's like magic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle puts the box on the desk, takes the lid off, takes three badges from his pocket... puts them in.  Takes out his revolver, drops it in, followed by two more guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our gift to you.  Something you've always wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle puts the lid on, adorns it with a tattered gift bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our resignations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going rogue on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Kittle?  We used to be friends.  You used to know how the game was played.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean taking bribes, and skimming busts and letting hoods walk? You mean not being able to sleep at night after shaking down some honest Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a time when you did things the right way, till you hooked up with that fat-assed-boozehound and the soul-sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle just shrugs... walks.  But, he stops in the doorwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, there's one more thing... (walks back) Now, where did I put that... ? (searching pockets) Uh... oh, here it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle takes his fist from his pocket and holds it up, admiring it a moment, smiling, then SUCKER PUNCHING... The captain's knocked to the floor, nose bloodied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle crosses to leave.  Captain Albert comes to shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're washed up, Kittle!  You're all done!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops stare.  Captain Albert tries to control his temper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert closes and locks the door.  He goes to the window, takes out the detonator. He flicks the switch.  GREEN BULB on the detonator LIGHTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle joins Nena and Billy-Boy in the Torino.  Peel out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino bursts into sunlight, hits pavement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert looks to the street three stories below, gripping the detonator, angry breath fogging the window. THRU THE WINDOW: the Torino's moving away. Captain Albert holds up the detonator. His thumb caresses the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good riddance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His thumb tenses. THRU THE WINDOW: the Torino spins, turning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino u-turns, coming to a halt facing the precinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert lowers the detonator, watching, curious. THRU THE WINDOW: Nena can be seen getting out, carrying something to a phone booth close by.  She dials the phone PHONE RINGS O.S.  Captain Albert looks to the phone on hi desk,  He answers it, brings it to the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What... ? (from phone) How you doing up there in your ivory tower, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the phone booth, Nena waves up to the captain's window Kittle and Billy-Boy are looking up from in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'm gonna let you in on a secret. See, that wasn't my "voodoo music" I was listening to before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena lifts her tape recorder, HITS PLAY. (from recorder) ... are you calling me here? (from recorder) Calmly Captain.  If it weren't important..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert's face goes slack. (from over phone) ... I wouldn't disturb the fine work you do.  Your children played with their guns in front of me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Albert unscrews his mouthpiece... something falls Rolls on the floor, stops: a micro-transmitter. Captain Albert trembles, holds up the detonator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Burn in hell, whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the button... THRU THE WINDOW: nothing happens to the Torino.  A quiet BEEPING is HEARD 0.S.... BEEP... BEEP... A moment of confusion for Captain Albert, then he turns.. The BEEPING comes from the SHOEBOX Kittle left on the des Stark terror.  Captain Albert leaps to grab the box... He tears off the lid.  The bomb is there, under guns and badges.  He grabs it, throws it... The bomb spins, heading for the window... A brief look of relief on Captain Albert's face... As the bomb hits the window... but, bounces off... Falls to the floor. Captain Albert's expression returns to terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Nena, Kittle and Billy-Boy's vantage point: the EXPLOSION BLOWS OUT the captain's window! Cops look up, alarmed, shouting and pointing. They run as shards of glass fall to the sidewalk. Nena returns to the Torino.  Kittle revs and speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DISCO MUSIC.  Mock sex on stage.  Pop-Sweet, arm in a cas is behind the bar with Pinkeye, counting cash. Pop-Sweet enters cash figures in a large, bound ACCOUNTAN LEDGER book full of columns of handwritten numbers. At the club entrance, Lord Caviar's playing bouncer. Kittle enters, breezing past with a shotgun.  Lord Caviar does a double take, can't believe it, follows... Behind, Billy-Boy and Nena enter, following Lord Caviar.. Lord Caviar reaches in his jacket for his gun, closing in Kittie.  Billy-Boy SWINGS a golf club -- THWACKS Lord Cav in the back of the head. Lord Caviar falls face first to the floor.  Kittle doesn' even look back, cocks his shotgun, aims...            - In the BOOTH, the D.J. jumps for cover as buckshot SHATTE glass and record albums.  FEEDBACK SCREECHES. Behind the bar, Pop-Sweet and Pinkeye react. Billy-Boy and Nena head for the bar, passing Kittle as Kittle retargets his shotgun upwards and FIRES... The disco GLITTER BALL EXPLODES! Customers, waitresses and strippers scatter.  Pop-Sweet a Pinkeye take out weapons... Billy-Boy holds his golf club by its shaft between his teeth, leveling two handguns, and Nena's already FIRING.. Bullets hit the bar, BUSTING BOTTLES and MIRRORS.  Pop-Sw and Pinkeye are forced to duck down. Billy-Boy and Nena keep BLASTING, still moving forward. Kittle drops his shotgun, produces two revolvers and move to the bar, adding to the gunfire barrage -- BLAM, BLAM, BLAM -- between Nena and Billy-Boy, who stop to reload, Behind the bar, Pop-Sweet and Pinkeye go fetal, covered i broken glass and debris. Kittle stops firing.  Nena and Billy-Boy come to flank hi pointing reloaded weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, flesh-peddler, let's see empty hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out here.  On your knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands rise, then Pop-Sweet and Pinkeye show their faces. They move from behind the bar, seething.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do this to me!  Who the fuck do you think you are!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle takes the driver from Billy-Boy's teeth, swings it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who am I, you say? (hefting club, moving forward) I am one angry, angry man... Freeze, piggies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind, Lord Caviar points a gun, clutching his bloody he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I shoulda used a 9-iron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose the guns or I'll smoke you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes drop their many weapons, raising their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you got it all backasswards again, Kittle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkeye moves towards the cops.  Lord Caviar edges in fro the other side.  No way out for our heroes. Nena moves her fingertips along her coat sleeve seam... readies a six-pointed sherikan (Oriental throwing star). Nena glances to Billy-Boy... Billy-Boy glances to Kittle. Kittle glances to Nena... At the bar, Pop-Sweet lifts a broken, jagged bottle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought you got hurt last time... you ain't seen nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkeye bends to retrieve a gun off the floor.  Kittle spins, SMASHES his foot down on Pinkeye's hand! Nena spins, throwing the sharp-edged star at Lord Caviar. The throwing star SLICES Lord Caviar's face.  He recoils, crying out and misfiring his gum. Kittle kicks Pinkeye in the head, then turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle kicks the golf club off the floor... The golf club spins in the air... Billy-Boy catches the club, SWINGS without missing a beat Lord Caviar's recovered and aiming his gun just as Billy- SWINGS the club -- KNOCKS the gun across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet moves forward with the bottle, but Nena steps u poised kung-fu ready.  Pop-Sweet hesitates, circling. Across the room, Lord Caviar rushes forwards and tackles Billy-Boy, toppling tables.  They battle. Pinkeye's rising, but Kittle PUNCHES. Pop-Sweet stabs the jagged bottle at Nena.  Nena high-kic disarming Pop-Sweet, then spins flawlessly... KICKS Pop-Sweet's chin, sending him backwards. Billy-Boy kicks Lord Caviar off... Lord Caviar gets up, charges headlong at Billy-Boy. Billy-Boy raises his club, side-stepping...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-B swings -- CLUNK -- sends Lord Caviar onward... Lord Caviar CRASHES head-first into a cigarette machine. Pop-Sweet scrambles up, throwing a chair at Nena, which s dodges.  Pop-Sweet flees... Kittle KNEES Pinkeye's head... sees Pop-Sweet running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  I'll finish this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle runs after Pop-Sweet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet bursts out a side door, heading for daylight. Kittle pursues, sprinting.  Billy-B follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena watches Pinkeye and Lord Caviar get up.  She preps, feet apart, doing martial arts warm-ups as they approach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you that good, sister?  Think you can handle us both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lord Caviar grins, moves in.  Pinkeye attacks... Nena blocks, PUNCHES, CHOPS, SPINS and SLAPS, then finish with a GROIN KICK.  Pinkeye hits the dirt. Lord Caviar strikes.  Nena FLIPS HIM... BOOM -- Lord Caviar lands flat, lays there gasping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't call it a black belt for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the bar, Nena comes to claim the money ledger, tilting to clear off the shattered glass it's buried under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Busy sidewalks.  Pop-Sweet runs, fearful.  Kittle chases. Billy-Boy brings up the rear. Pop-Sweet PUSHES pedestrians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta the way!  Move!

dialogues.speaker: AROUND A CORNER
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet arrives, full speed, looking back... SLAMS a "M TO STARS HOMES" sign and TRASH CAN, upsetting them and knocking a map-hawking kid out of his lawn chair... Pop-Sweet rolls in star-maps and garbage.  Gets up... Keeps running. Kittle leaps the trash can. A moment, then Billy-Boy arrives, leaps... Trips over the trash can, falls hard.  Scrambles up. AHEAD, Pop-Sweet shoves an OLD WOMAN to the ground. People gather to help the Old Woman up.  She's thanking t as Kittle comes barreling thru... knocking her down again

dialogues.speaker: AT AN INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet runs across, catty-corner.  Cars swerve and bra CRASHING all around,.. Pop-Sweet gets HIT, rolls across a car's hood... CRACKS the windshield and rolls off... Pop-Sweet recovers, dazed, stumbling to sidewalk... Kittle's bearing down, makes a diving tackle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Pop-Sweet SMASH thru the front window. The SHOP OWNER and a WEALTHY LADY react, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my Lord, no!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Pop-Sweet wrestle, punching and grappling, surrounded on all sides by antiquities and shelves loaded with precious knick-knacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no!  Stop this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet swings his arm cast -- KNOCKS Kittle back... Kittle lands against shelves... Fragile items teeter on the brink, miraculously not falli Pop-Sweet runs up a nearby STAIRCASE. Kittle leaps to follow. The shop owner goes to steady the shelves.  Behind, THRU BROKEN WINDOW: we can see Billy-Boy rumbling this directi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sigh of relief) Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shop owner takes a step back.  Billy-Boy jumps thru t broken window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUMPS the shop owner, heading for stairs... The shop owner's knocked forward, SLAMMING shelves.  Dish and trinkets SHATTER.  Shelves COLLAPSE like dominoes.

dialogues.speaker: EXT H 'WOOD ROOFTOPS
dialogues.text: AERIAL LONG SHOT (VIA ADJACENT ROOFTOPS): Pop-Sweet flees out a rooftop door.  Kittle follows.  They jump from roof roof.  Billy-Boy arrives, far behind, really dragging.

dialogues.speaker: ON ROOFTOPS
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet leaps from a higher ledge, runs to an open door Above, Kittle arrives, sees Pop-Sweet go thru that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet hurries downstairs, into a hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet comes through a door at the back of the theater gasping, squinting in the dark. The theater's pretty crowded.  On the screen, Linda Blair curses and vomits im "The Exorcist."  Pop-Sweet heads dow the center aisle, looks back... Kittle enters from the same door.  He spots Pop-Sweet. Kittle chases.  Pop-Sweet picks up the pace, yelling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire!  Fire!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet runs to an exit as panic begins.  PEOPLE SCREAM and pour into the aisle.  Kittle curses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed, to himself)    - Fucking first amendment violation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's caught in the rush of patrons, like trying to sw upstream.  It's useless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet pushes out the exit, followed by theater-goers. He runs down an alleyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's in the mob exiting below the marquee.  He pushes through, heading down the block. Billy-Boy comes out... follows Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet enters this deserted alley, exhausted.  He look around, has an idea... climbs into a TRASH DUMPSTER, clos the lid.  After a moment, Kittle arrives, running past... Billy-Boy arrives, watches Kittle disappear around the ne corner.  Billy-Boy follows, red faced... stops, doubled-over, breathless. Giving up, Billy-Boy goes to sit on the ground, beside th dumpsters, takes out his cigarettes.  A moment, then, mer inches above Billy-Boy's head, one dumpster lid raises an Pop-Sweet peers out. Pop-Sweet looks around, with Billy-Boy just below his sig line, satisfied the coast is clear.  Pop-Sweet throws the lid open and starts to climb out.  Billy-Boy looks up... Pop-Sweet looks down -- they both cry out in surprise. Billy-Boy jumps, grabbing, but Pop-Sweet clamors atop another dumpster, looks up... There's a long LADDER up the side of the building.  It's within reach.  Pop-Sweet starts climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy awkwardly climbs the dumpster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle runs out from the alley, searching. (distant) Kittle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle hears, backtracks, running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle arrives, confused... looks up... Pop-Sweet's high on the ladder, hampered by his broken ar Billy-Boy climbs after.  Four stories up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, jeez, Billy... careful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy grabs at Pop-Sweet's ankles.  Pop-Sweet kicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you let him fall!  You hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy grabs Pop-Sweet again, hanging on to his pants leg.  Pop-Sweet hooks his cast around a rung, swinging wi his good hand, beating on Billy. Pop-Sweet's cast arm slips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't drop him!  We need him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop-Sweet falls... screaming... Kittle watches him drop.  The SICKENING THUD is HEARD O.S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle lets out a sigh, looks admonishingly up at Billy-B Billy-Boy looks down, ashamed, embarrassed, at a loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Facing a vast view of the cityscape, Zimmermann's alone, continuing to play his Stradivarius violin.  He's as awfu as before, but the difference is his patience is less. His level of frustration has brought him near tears as he tries over and over to play a section of music that just refuses to come out anything other than jarring squeaks. Finally, Zimmermann grips the Stradivarius by the neck an SMASHES it against the porch wall, again and again, till that's left of it are very expensive toothpicks. Zimmermann catches his breath, in a terrible state, regretting.  Expecting to feel better, he feels much wors Excuse me... Mister Zinmermann...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann wheels to see Balls and Poe arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balls walks over, begins whispering in Zimmermann's ear. Balls finishes, steps back.  Zimmermann ponders, then crosses on his way back into the mansion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them, Poe.  Find them, and make them very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.A. Ravich studies the captain's bombed out office, grim He turns to the doorway, addressing POLICEMEN assembled i the vice squad bullpen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest them.  Brimg them to me. Bring them to justice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Steve pays for coffee near a pie display reading "Happy Pie-Centenial!"  He WHISTLES at a passing woman in mini-skirt.  A BLAST of SIREN is HEARD.  He looks. Outside, Officer Jim's in the squad car, motioning for Officer Steve to pull out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Steve climbs in the car beside Officer Jim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.P.B. came over the radio.  They just declared open season on the Three Stooges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) What are we waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The squad car takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena sits atop the Torino, reading Pop-Sweet's ledger boo waiting.  Kittle and Billy-Boy are on their way from down the block, worn-out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chalk up another victory for Billy-Boy's one man war on crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said it wa's me, hub?  Anyway... he fell off a ladder.  It wasn't really my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I got something.. (holds open ledger) Pop-Sweet's accounting ledger for the Disco-Strip.  All the money transactions.  Look... (shows ledger to Kittle) Someone's putting their initials beside the weekly totals.  Like they're acknowledging a deposit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?  Zimmermann's money-man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is, that's pretty high up on the totem pole.  What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimmie a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle leans against the Torino, brooding, hands in pocke He looks down, touching the folded poster, remembering...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The "DEEP ASS" poster featuring Billy-B's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE ON STREET
dialogues.text: Kittle pushes the poster back in his pocket, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright... how about you two hit the strip and start knocking some heads together?  Find out who "A.D." is.  I got a quick errand to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena slides down off the car while Kittle gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kittle) Where you gonna be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's personal. (starts the car) We'll hook up at Billy-Boy's pad in an hour.  See ya then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle drives away.  Billy-Boy and Nena start down the street.  FREEZE FRAME... STILL PHOTO/SPLIT-SCREEN MONTAGE begins, accompanied by a SOULFUL THEME SONG as the SCREEN DIVIDES into FOUR SECTIO and STILL PHOTOGRAPHS appear in each: Kittle drives the Torino, looks                 Nena and Billy-Boy at his watch.                        flatfoot it down The parade of the Tall Ships                    Nena and Billy-Boy in New York Harbor.            question a wild-eyed Prez Ford gives                           Billy-Boy asks a speech on the steps                  questions of a of Independence Hall                   glam-rock singer. in Philadelphia. The glam-rock singer                   Billy-Boy slaps seems to be giving                        the glam-rock s Billy-Boy an argument.                 senseless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena and Billy-Boy                Shriners in fez hats talk to a strung-out           drive miniature cars junkie whose entire            in a Bicentennial torso is covered in            parade. tattoos. Nena and Billy-Boy                Nena and Billy-Boy question hookers,                 question a leather-clad showing the ledger.            S+M macho-man stud. Nena holds a gas                   Old men pose station attendant                  wearing Colonial in a choke hold                    costumes. while Billy-Boy questions him angrily. A poodle wears a                   Torino in front of a R,W+B sweater and                  run-down apartment little booties.                    complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle gets out of                Billy-Boy and Nena the Torino.                          continue down Sunset Billy-Boy and Nena question another                  Billy-Boy throttles junkie who wears a                the antenna-wearing top-hat with antennas          junkie. coming out the top. Billy-Boy knocks                  On a busy highway, the antenna-wearing            a huge parade float junkie down and                   bust of Abe Lincoln's kicks him                            head is towed by a repeatedly.                          R,W+B pick-up truck. Kittle stands' in front of the apartment complex... STILL-PHOTO/SPLIT SCREEN MONTAGE ENDS as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This last PHOTO of Kittle ENLARGES to FULL SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle stands in front of the apartment complex, lets out resigned sigh.  He goes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle flattens the "Deep Ass" poster on a table. Billy-Boy's "school-marm" looks on, sad.  The apartment's horrid.  "Love American Style" plays on T.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I can explain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking at this poster, and I'm thinkin', I don't remember seeing films like this when I was in school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you gonna say?  Exactly how did you think he was gonna make the leap from dating a sweet, innocent school teacher to an ass-fucking porn star?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) But... I love him.  I do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-B's girlfriend buries her face in her hands, weepy, Kittle starts looking around for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is, you're setting up my pal for the world's biggest broken heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle finds a pad of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell him.  Let him decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not gonna see him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... what makes you think you can order me around?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm not making myself clear. You're probably the first girl Billy-Boy's ever fallen in love with, and I know for sure you're the first he's slept with.  So, how's he gonna feel... (holds up poster) ... when he finds out that the only first he is for you is the first guy who didn't have to pull out at the last second to get his close-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "school-marm" wipes tears, miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasn't he got enough problems, or didn't you notice that's not cream soda on his breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... okay... you made your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle lays the pad of paper on the table, places a ball-point pen on the pad, pulls out a chair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino pulls up the drive of Billy-Boy's tiny house. DOWN THE STREET, in a parked Cadillac, Zimmermann's hench Mickey takes notice.  He lifts the microphone of a CB RAD BEHIND THE HOUSE, Kittle parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle jimmies the back door and enters.  He looks around opens a drawer... digs up a garbage bag. IN THE BEDROOM, Kittle goes to sort thru the closet.  He pulls dresses and skirts, stuffing them in the garbage ba He removes a bra from the back of a chair. IN THE BATHROOM,  Kittle opens the medicine cabinet, find lipstick, make-up and tampons.  Puts them in the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle comes out the back.  At trash cans, he shoves the garbage bag deep, buries it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle returns to place an envelope on a coffee table. VOICES are HEARD OUTSIDE... a KEY IN THE LOCK.  Kittle hurries out just as Nena and Billy-Boy enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle slips out the back.  FOLLOW as he moves along the side of the house, keeping low, to the front. Down the street, in the Cadillac, Mickey watches, confuse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy goes to refill his flask near shelves which hol PITTSBURGH STEELERS SHRINE: Super Bowl IX pennant, autographed Terry Bradshaw photo and other memorabilia. Billy-Boy crosses himself at the shrine, making sure Nena doesn't notice.  Nena's looking around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You live like a pig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you say something nice once?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  It doesn't smell as bad in here as I remember it smelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle comes in the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been waiting long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A.D. is a C.P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archibald Dobbs; Certified Public Accountant.  But, that's all we got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle finds a yellow pages PHONE BOOK in a pile of magazines, goes to open it on the coffee table, paging th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offices are gonna be open today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching phone book) Lots of these pencil-pushers work out of their homes.  It's a tax dodge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad news is, word's spreading like wildfire that we don't have badges, and nobody wants to end up getting splattered like Butch Cassidy either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't catch a break soon, we're gonna be left standing with our dicks in our hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy notices the envelope Kittle left on the table. picks it up, curious... unfolds the letter inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (searching yellow pages) Bingo.  Got him... (TEARS PAGE OUT) Let's pay Archibald a visit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle stands, then notices Billy-Boy reading the letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you got there, Billy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy keeps reading, disbelieving, filled with sadnes He lowers the letter, staring off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She... she's gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes letter, reading) Dear Billy... been thinking about us... decided you're too good for me. I don't deserve you... (jumps ahead) Don't try to find me... (to Billy-Boy) Sorry, kid.  That's a tough break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy looks zombie-like, reaches to take the letter, studies it.  He rips it up.  Pause... then, Billy-Boy lif the coffee table and chucks it across the room. Kittle and Nena back off. Billy-Boy goes berserk, wrecking the place.  He flips the couch, pulls down shelves, knocks pictures off walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another Cadillac arrives with Balls and THUG-ONE.  Mickey gets out of his Caddie, preps a machine gun.  Poe pulls u in his souped-up MUSTANG with THUG-TWO as a passenger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Nena watch Billy-B destroy his television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taking this better than I thought he would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy swats a lamp, kicks furniture, stumbles, looks around, breathing heavily.  Pause... then, he sits, burst into tears.  Nena moves to comfort him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa... it's gonna be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... where... where's a jerk like me ever gonna find another girl to love him... huh?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy sobs, truly heartbroken.  Nena hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk like that.  There's plenty of women around for jerks like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's sad, unsure.  He pets Billy-Boy's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good guy, Billy.  These things happen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy hugs Nena.  She holds him, really feels for him Kittle notices something strange... crosses... At the window, Kittle pulls the curtain: sees Poe and fou other villains heading across the lawn with lots of guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe spots Kittle at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Villains OPEN FIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle turns and leaps onto Nena and Billy-Boy, bowling t over in mid-hug as the FRONT WINDOW IS BLOWN TO SMITHEREE DOZENS of BULLETS and SHOTGUN BLASTS pepper the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe and the others move in, all SHOOTING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy crawls, wiping tears, terrified.  Nena and Kitt follow.  Glass, plaster and splinters of wood shower down Billy-Boy looks back... Sees his STEELERS SHRINE BLASTED to PIECES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Motherfuckers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE KITCHEN, Billy-Boy, Kittle and Nena sprawl through the doorway.  BULLETS RICOCHET.  Cupboards are blown open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy, Nena and Kittle tumble out the back door. They scramble towards the Torino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Villains keep up the assault.  The Torino appears from around the side of the house, ZOOMING down the drive... Villains redirect their fire.  The Torino hits the street Heading away.  Poe shouts orders as he and his fellow assassins run to their vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes the Torino, full out.... BEHIND: two Cadillacs followed by the Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's loading a pump shotgun, muttering angrily...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroy a man's Steelers shrine. That's a declaration of war!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy turns to peer out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we got... one, two... three... (up to Kittle) Two Caddies and Poe's Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could be worse.  I don't know how, but I'm sure it could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena sits backwards in her seat, on her knees, fastens he seatbelt.  She leans out her window, FIRING...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Mickey shifts lanes as his windshield sprouts BULLET HOLE Poe's Mustang pulls ahead of the Cadillacs.  Thug-Two lea out the passenger window and FIRES a MACHINE GUN... BULLETS STRIKE the Torino's ass.  REAR WINDOW SHATTERS.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle hunkers down.  Nena reloads.  Billy-Boy's horizont

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy-Boy) You plan on shooting that gun or just hugging it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm waiting till the time's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sometime before we're all dead would be nice, if it's not too much fucking trouble, yellow-belly!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: In the Mustang, Thug-Two withdrawals to reload. Billy-Boy pops up in the Torino's rear window, BLASTING.. The Mustang's right HEADLIGHT FRAGMENTS.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy PUMPS the shotgun, targeting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's too far back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks in the rearview, hits brakes...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino slows, bringing the Mustang closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy FIRES... Poe and Thug-Two duck as their HOOD is BLOWN CLEAN OFF...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoo-hoo!  Flipped his lid!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The hood spins in the air... bounces off Balls' Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Poe curses, downshifting, exposed ENGINE WHINING...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Mustang falls back.  Mickey's Cadillac comes to the Torino's driver side... BASHING... SLAMMING... Billy-Boy FIRES out the side window... CRACKS Mickey's windshield, but Mickey keeps RAMMING.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: The chase roars past. IN THE OPPOSITE LANE, a police squad car passes...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SQUAD CAR
dialogues.text: Officers Steve and Jim crane their necks, looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure as shit I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Jim spins the wheel...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The squad car jumps the divider, u-turning.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD, DOWN THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino and Mickey's Cadillac keep slamming. They separate to get around a slow truck, then... SLAM back together. BEHIND: GUNFIRE from Balls' Caddie...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle flinches as a BULLET DESTROYS his REARVIEW MIRROR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is completely, Goddamn unacceptable!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Kittle accelerates as Billy-B and Nena return fire.  The Torino moves left, cutting in front of Mickey's Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle looks to Nena, who's reloading again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raises and cocks guns) Your wish is my command.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino brakes, keeping left, which brings Mickey's Cadillac along Nena's side as Nena OPENS FIRE... Mickey ducks as his WINDOW IMPLODES... Kittle jams the steering wheel right... FORCING Mickey's Cadillac over, toward sidewalk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru clenched teeth) This one's for McDoogle's kid!!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Mickey's Cadillac COLLIDES with parked cars -- lifting impossibly, airborne, spinning sideways. CRASHING an abandoned STOREFRONT as citizens flee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) Bye-bye bad guy!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Back at the storefront, Mickey's Cadillac BURSTS INTO FLA Debris flies.  And then, as one might expect, Mickey leap out from fire, BURNING FROM HEAD TO TOE, running in circl flapping his arms!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AT THE MOUTH OF A TUNNEL, the Torino soars out, heading downhill to mid-city streets. The Mustang and Balls' Cadillac follow... The squad car tails, still in the running.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: A SIREN is HEARD behind.  Kittle glances back, happy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey-Ho... !  Maybe we're not alone in this thing after all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifts sunglasses, squints back) Who is that... ?

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: In Balls' Cadillac, Thug-One SHOOTS at the squad car as i passes.  Officer Steve returns fire. Then, the squad car overtakes Poe's Mustang.  Officer Ste SHOOTS at Poe.  The Mustang swerves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Far out, man!  Get those bastards!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy gives a thumbs-up, smiling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking hot-dogging vice pricks. Let's see how hot you are now... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Steve levels his pistol at the Torino...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: The smile is wiped off Biliy-Boy's face as Officer Steve FIRES at him repeatedly.  Our heroes duck and cringe...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino takes a sharp turn, gaining breathing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's his problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, besides the warrant out on us for blowing up our commanding officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy rise's with his "Steelers" helmet on, peers bac recognizing the officers behind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember those two uniform cops who been giving us such a hard time... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones you got in that fist-fight with a couple a weeks ago... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's them trying to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they sure know how to hold a grudge.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino makes another shrill turn... Past a "WRONG WAY" sign, up a "ONE WAY" street...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: THRU THE WINDSHIELD: lots of cars heading this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle lays on the horn, steering...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ONE WAY STREET
dialogues.text: Chaos.  The Torino weaves thru traffic.  HORNS BLARE. Cars SMASH each other to avoid head-on collisions... Behind, the patrol car slows, breaking away, choosing another route.  But, the Mustang follows the Torino... Side-swiping other vehicles, SCRAPING past, RAGING FORWAR Behind, Balls' Cadillac RAMS cars aside... Takes the path of least resistance: sidewalk... PLOWING THRU clothing racks and tables of a "SIDEWALK SAL The Cadillac clips tall SCAFFOLDING on its way back to th street.  The scaffolding lets out a CREAKING GROAN... Scaffolding falls... In the street, drivers inspecting their crashed cars must now to run for their lives as scaffolding CRASHES DOWN. Above, WORKMEN hang from windowsills, screaming.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE BLOCK
dialogues.text: The Torino hits open street, blasting forward. Congestion ahead, so the Torino cuts across sidewalk BOUNCING up a wide, marble staircase...

dialogues.speaker: IN AN OPEN AIR PLAZA
dialogues.text: A FOLK SINGER plays guitar and sings about "peace, love a happiness" for an audience gathered around a fountain.  M others are picnicking on blankets nearby. The Torino ROARS as it reaches the top of the stairs... Heading straight for the crowd... Pigeons take flight.  People shriek and flee.  Many are knocked into the fountain.  The Torino cruises thru. Behind, the Mustang and Cadillac follow..

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PLAZA
dialogues.text: The Torino RUMBLES down another staircase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW as the Torimo arrives, spinning out, moving on... RIPPING PAST cross streets... Gaining some distance on the Mustang and Caddie. Behind, the sguad car turns off one cross street, fishtailing to rejoin the chase.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD
dialogues.text: Kittle takes the Torino down a long block...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (daunted) Okay... it just got worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THRU WINDSHIELD: busy CONSTRUCTION SITE.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino races by signs: "LANE ENDS" and "ONE LANE AHEA The Torino halts at the rear of a long line of cars, ENGI SNORTING.  Up front, a yawning FLAGMAN holds a "STOP" sig Kittle sticks his head out, looking... Construction vehicles and a huge mound of dirt block the right lane.  Opposing traffic's coming thru on the left. Kittle sweats.  He looks back... Here they come: Mustang... Cadillac... squad car...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy aims his shotgun out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever we're gonna do, we should do it now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle shifts, reverse, heading backwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... wrong way.  See, the bad men are back there, and we want to go away from them!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Torino angles, stops, then heads forward, squeaking p the long line of cars... PICKING UP SPEED...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: AHEAD: the mound of dirt... WHIP PAN: to Nena, who realizes, looking to Kittle, who i intensely goal-focused, in a zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're... you're not doing what I think you're doing... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seatbelts fastened, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy faces front, confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if we make it.. which we won't... we don't know what's on the other side!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy figures it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no... no, no, no!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ENGINE'S HUMMING.  Nena braces her feet on the dash, head between her knees.  Billy-Boy sees this, dizzy with fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be calm) Look, Kittle... pull over and let me out.  I'll be fine... okay?  How 'bout that... ? (absolutely freaking) Oh, Lord almighty, listen to me... I don't want to die!!  Lemme out of this coffin!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clench your teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh... what... ?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clench your teeth so when we land you don't accidentally bite off your tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy lets out a weak whimper, sits back, gripping ceiling straps and closing his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Construction workers dive for safety. The Torino hits the dirt mound, riding up.... Taking flight... High above... Lands with a WHOOMP!, throwing dust, rocketing onward...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Kittle gives a HOOT of joy.  Nena plants a kiss on him. back, Billy-Boy half-giggles/half-cries, giddy.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET, BEHIND
dialogues.text: The Mustang ZOOMS off the dirt ramp... flying... Followed by Balls' Cadillac... skyward... They both land upright, surviving...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND
dialogues.text: The squad car FLIES over the dirt mound... soaring... Something's wrong.  Off balance, slowly flipping... BOOOOOOOM! -- lands flat on its roof, pancaked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A narrow spillway.  At the top, the Torino BASHES thru a chain-link gate, heading down... Into the far-as-the-eye-can-see expanses of the concrete Los Angeles River.  The Torino picks up the pace, riding sloped wall. LONG-SHOT AERIAL VIEW: as the Mustang and Cadillac shadow the Torino.  Straightaway.  SPEEDS BECOME EXCESSIVE...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Nena cranks a handle above, opening a SUNROOF.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RIVER BASIN
dialogues.text: Nena stands up thru the sunroof, aiming two guns back... Behind, Poe slows, letting Balls' Cadillac take the lead. Thug-One leans out, FIRING a MACHINE GUN... Nena shoots, DOUBLE BLASTING...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Thug-One's gun empties.  He leans in to reload.  He doesn notice yet: Balls is a gory, bullet-ridden mess beside hi slumped against the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch can't hit a thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thug-One finishes loading, lets out a nervous laugh, glan at Balls' corpse... does a double-take... Thug-One looks forward, opening his mouth to scream...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RIVER BASIN
dialogues.text: The Cadillac EXPLODES as it SLAMS a bridge abutment dead center.  Sounds like a THUNDER-CLAP.  HUGE FIREBALL... The Mustang bursts thru the flame, unrelenting... Kittle takes the Torino down off the wall... KNIFING thru shallow water... Up the opposite wall... The Mustang follows suit with Thug-Two SHOOTING...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. GOLF COURSE
dialogues.text: Chain link fence borders the L.A. River.  A golf cart putters past.  The Torino and Mustang BUST up and out thr the fence, taking off across the golf course...

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE
dialogues.text: On the tee, an elderly GENTLEMAN GOLFER, in plaid knicker and a pom-pom cap, tees off.  Good hit... He watches his ball go, squinting.  Far off, down the fairway, the Torino and Mustang cross the lush, rolling hills, EXCHANGING GUNFIRE...

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE FAIRWAY
dialogues.text: The golf ball bounces off the hood of the Torino.

dialogues.speaker: UP ON THE TEE
dialogues.text: Gentleman Golfer watches the cars pass.  GUNSHOTS ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's peculiar. (long pause, to caddie) Winter rules, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON
dialogues.text: The Torino and Mustang clash, BUMPING each other... JOSTLING for position.  Really moving... The Torino heads downhill, swerving... BASHING the Mustan guiding it... towards a SAND TRAP... Poe realizes too late, crying out... The Mustang hits the sand trap, WHEELS WHINING, SPINNING THROWING SAND high in the air.  Immediately immobile. Poe pounds the wheel in frustration, going ape-shit. The Torino continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino BURSTS out from a line of thick shrubbery, ont semi-busy street, joins the flow of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big party.  Loud.  Party-goers move in the trippy flicker STROBE LIGHTS, drinking and drugging.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy arrive, scanning.. In the middle of the' crowd, there's a NUDE WOMAN in only mink coat standing on top a piano, writhing and laughing hysterically for no reason, non-stop; laughing and laughi and laughing, though we can't hear her over the din. Half the room's taken up by a makeshift indoor volleyball court, where men and women play NAKED VOLLEYBALL.  These aren't all "beautiful people" either.  There's plenty of middle-aged men and women who should have kept clothes on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Beverly Hills. Wife-swapping Capital of the World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle leads the way.  A big, NAKED BODY-BUILDER comes to block their path.  Kittle grimaces, afraid to look down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, fella... I need to see your invitations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what?  You gonna hit us over the head with your penis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body-Builder grips Kittle.  Nena and Billy-B brandish gun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your baby-lotioned hands off him, Zeus.  Good.  Now, come here...

dialogues.speaker: IN A HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Nena leads Naked Body-Builder with her gun to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna tell us where Archie the accountant is.  But first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out HANDCUFFS, snaps one cuff around a doorknob and secures it, then holds up the other cuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to guess which part of your body's going in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC THROBS.  People dance, drenched, STROBE-LIT.  Bad fashion choices.  They're really shaking their bootie, banging asses together, grabbing and gyrating, oversexed. Kittle, Nena and Billy-B shove thru this jumble, moving o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the porch, surrounded by coke mirrors and bowls of R,W pills, three nubile YOUNG WOMEN sit in the frothing HOT T drinking champagne and giggling. Then, ARCHIE, a middle-aged, hairy-chested sleaze-ball in gold chains, pops up from under the water, laughing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, that's what I call diving for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's YANKED out of the hot tub by the chains around his neck, ending that sentence with a guttural CHOKE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's shoved into the garage, catches himself against red Trans-Am, wet and vulnerable in his bathing suit.  He turns to face Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is private property.  This is breaking and entering!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just entering.  We'll get to the breaking in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's shifty, crosses his arms to cover nipples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you fuzz are sniffing for, I don't have it.  You came to the wrong place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle throws the ledger book and Archie catches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Zimmermann's calculator, Archie.  All the blood money you had to move around to make this deal, you got to know something.  Maybe they told you, maybe you overheard things you weren't supposed to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, you're barking up the wrong tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (furious) Well, I'm running out of trees, so look me in the eye like a man and tell me you don't know!  Convince me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flinching, miserable) I don't know.  Fuck off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studies Archie) You suck at lying, Archie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See... now that we know you know, the hard part's done for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a question of how long do we have to slap you silly till you spill the beans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this deal goes smooth, I clear three hundred fifty grand.  That's enough for three more houses like this.  And, what are you offering me instead, other than a black eye and a fat lip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle motions.  Billy-Boy steps up, puts Archie in a cho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... there, just like that... (submits) Okay, go ahead.  But first take a good look around at how I'm living, and then think about your own shitty lives...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle pushes Billy-Boy aside, GUT-PUNCHES Archie.  Archi gasping.  Billy-Boy PUNCHES him, sends him sprawling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching breath) I know the drill.  Maybe I can't stop you from beating on me... but, I'll heal up.  It doesn't change the fact that cops eat hamburgers and hot dogs while crooks eat lobster and caviar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle KICKS.  Archie rolls.  Kittle comes to lift Archie by gold chains, ready to punch again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary, resigned) It's not even like there's a choice to be made, so... do whatever you feel like you have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's unsure.  He drops Archie, frustrated, leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle leads the way back across the volleyball room, ang pushing stoned guests.  Billy-Boy lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're screwed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm well aware of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me.  You got a suggestion, feel free to shout it out, genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle glances up, stops.  He's focused above, loathing.. ABOVE, on a balcony overlooking the party, ADAM, a gaunt, glassy-eyed blonde junkie in head-to-toe leather, smiles down.  He crooks his finger slyly; "come here."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our three heroes follow Adam in, wary.  Dim room.  Candle Adam sinks into a couch, puts his arm around EVE, a blond misfit-addict also slathered in leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgust, anger) Adam and Eve.  Never one without the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve's fixing, shooting heroin... ZOOM-IN CLOSE-UP: on the needle piercing Eve's arm. Nena's riveted by this, instantly queasy, averts her eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our names, don't wear'em out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve laughs, so stoned.  She puts the needle aside.  Adam gropes her face and they flick tongues together. Billy-Boy puts a hand on Nena's shoulder.  Nena gives him look to say she's okay, wiping sweat off her upper lip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Eve, lovingly) Indivisible and inseparable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incestuous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every person's got their own kinks, beef-cake. (stands, slinks forward) What's wrong, Kittle?  You don't swing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam rises to lavish attention, touching.  Kittle stews.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Eve and I wouldn't give to meet up with you on the business end of a daisy chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shoves Adam off) Put up your kickstand, freak.  Start talking, or we're out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little birdie whispered in my ear today... about the needle-candy you're chasing.  It's up here... (taps his forehead) ... in the old curiosity shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks questioningly to Nena and Billy-Boy, doubtfu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure, for this information, the usual payment... times ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you what... I think it's all you've got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (false smile) Well... what can I do?  You've created a dilemma... (looks at watch) And, look at the that. Time's running out.  I wonder... how can I impress upon you just exactly how frustrating this situation is for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy dutifully drops his cigarette, steps it out.  H grabs Adam and throws him across the room... Adam SMASHES a dresser and tumbles to the floor, smugness immediately replaced by shock and fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastards... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eve gets up, falls down, crawls to cradle Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get nothing and like it.  And if we're not blissfully happy with what you tell us, we arrest you just for the fun of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, man, okay.  I'm with you.  I... I heard how the shit's arriving... (leans forward, whispers) It's coming in a Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle's waiting for more.  There ain't more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What and?  That's what I got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Lincoln?  What Lincoln?  Lincoln Continental?  Lincoln Mark Five... Six... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know what to watch for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I supposed to take this information and sit up in the hills with a frickin' telescope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This much powder you don't throw in the trunk with a blanket over it. It's got to be smuggled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's not even enough places to stash it in a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I ever steered you wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pissed, to Billy-Boy) Cuff'em.  Let's see what these two love birds say once they're sitting in separate cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy pulls Eve off Adam, handcuffs her roughly as sh kicks and protests.  Adam grabs at her, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off her, monster!  Leave her alone... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy shoves Adam.  Nena restrains Adam, cuffing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy-Boy) Take her down to the car, and for Christ's sake be careful this time. (to Adam) Last suspect he took in, butter-fingers dropped her down the stairs.  What a mess.  Why is it we don't appreciate our arms and legs till we've lost the use of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperation rising) Hey, listen... I'll give you something else, Kittle.  Anything. Remember... remember that corpse washed up on Huntington Beach?  It was never identified...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, wait... there's a dentist in Brentwood peddling morphine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignores, to Billy-B) Careful she doesn't hit her head on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy drags Eve towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, don't you screw with her, please!  You... you got to want this: armored car job.  CalTrust Bank. They took two million in cash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read my lips: Zimmermann or nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up a minute, Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena drops Adam, motions for Kittle to follow her.  They huddle.  Nena whispers. Billy-B waits in the doorway with Eve, lights a cigarette Kittle nods to Nena, then returns to Adam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll take the CalTrust heist, but if it's no good, we will hunt you down, and Billy-Boy will pull out your spine and he will beat you to death with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirty window.  Kittle's face appears outside, peeking i thru grime.  He ducks away.  CAMERA MOVES... REVEALS an ARMORED CAR in the middle of the vast warehouse... and, away from the truck, SIX BANK ROBBERS, unwashed, frightening tough-guys, play poker, drink and smoke... and, nearby, a SUITCASE full of cash.  $2 millio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty streets like a ghost town.  Late in the day.  The sun's low.  Kittle hurries back to the parked Torino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're there, laying low.  It's Allison and Hinchberger's crew. Lunatics, every one of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena and Billy-Boy have duffel bags of guns on their laps sorting and trading bullets, loading every gun.  Kittle picks up his own bag, following suit. For a while, that's the only sound, of guns checked and loaded.  In back, Billy-Boy takes a deep swallow from his flask.  Kittle turns his head, seeing this, faces front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Billy-Boy) When you planning to cut back on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The booze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I could quit now if I wanted, I just don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (skeptical) Sure you could.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy studies his reflection in the flask, buzzed, sa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the problem is. Plenty of great men throughout history got their bravery out of a bottle

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean Martin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entertainers don't count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the time, they're still occupied loading guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Jack Daniels?  Wasn't he a decorated general in the Civil War?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Jim Beam, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Well.   I think it's pretty common knowledge that in the Battle of Little Big Horn, Custer was drunk off his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's been giving you history lessons?  Your bartender?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, seriously.  What about Napoleon, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've never heard of Napoleon brandy, Mister Smarty-Pants?  How do you think it got its name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy, I love you I really do... but I've got to tell you, every day, in every way, you give new meaning to the word "stupidity."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause) What can I say to that... except, I love you too, you mean-spirited bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front, Nena allows a thin smile, still loading.  Kittl turns ON the RADIO: "Beth" by Kiss. Kittle switches: "Midnight at the Oasis," "Fly, Robin, Fl by Silver Connection.  "The Night Chicago Died."  "Cats i the Cradle" by Harry Chapin.  "Da Doo Ron Ron" by Shaun Cassidy.   "Mr. Jaws."  "Billy Don't Be a Hero."  "Angie Baby."  Theme from t.v.'s "Happy Days."  "Nadia's Theme."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Nena, calm) Excuse me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle moves over, angling his body and lifting his heel he can KICK the radio -- SMASHING the radio into SILENCE. Kittle sits back down and calmly continues loading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big warehouse doors.  The Torino CRASHES thru! Across the warehouse, robbers leap to their weapons, runn for cover behind big wooden crates and industrial drums. The Torino skids to stop, sideways... Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy, wearing NYLONS stretched over their heads, jump out with duffel bags, taking cover behi the car.  Bullets THUNK against the Torino. Kittle's got got a BULLHORN, shouting into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru bullhorn) ... This is the police.  We don't want trouble... just come out with your hands up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank robbers peer out occasionally, FIRING sporadical

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thru bullhorn) Put down your weapons and surrender. I'm not kidding... this is your last chance.  Stop trying to kill us', or we will be forced to return fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbers curse them, keeping up their uneven attack. BEHIND THE BARRELS, Several robbers are reloading, not to quick, dropping bullets in their haste. BEHIND THE TORINO, Kittle gives Nena and Billy-Boy a look and a shrug.  He tosses the bullhorn aside... Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy open duffel bags in front of then, choosing guns, rising... FIRING, six guns in all, one per hand... Wooden crates splinter.  Holes burst in metal drums. Several robbers are hit, bloodied. Our heroes keep BLASTING.  As soon as a gun empties, it's thrown aside in favor of another from a duffel bag, facilitating NON-STOP FIRING... One robber rises up, FIRING.  He's hit, falling, bloody. Poker chips and cards are sent flying... BULLETS are HEARD RICOCHETING everywhere, throwing sparks Bank robbers are overwhelmed, hardly able to get in a sho GUNSHOTS are DEAFENING as Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy continue SHOOTING.  Gunsmoke grows thick and empty guns p up at their feet. One robber makes a run for an exit door, but he gets shot down on the way, falling, screaming. Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy stop firing.  GUNSHOTS ECHO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pause, shouting) If anybody's still alive over there... now would be a good time for you to run away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.  Two remaining robbers run, reaching an exit doo and escaping, not looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's house.  Archie's in the shower.  PHONE'S RINGING Archie gets a towel, answers the nearby phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah? (listens, impatient) I got nothing to say to you... huh? How's that... (interest piqued) I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA MOVES: to the ajar door.  Someone's there...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ADJOINING BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A REDHEAD, one of the hot tub bikini girls, stands eavesdropping.  She crosses... Carefully picks up a phone, listening. (from phone) This is something you should seriously consider.  What do you say? (pause, from phone) Meet me on Mulholland.  Above Outpost Drive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Party MUSIC's still THROBBING elsewhere.  The Redhead mov thru waning weirdoes, reaches a phone, dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waits for answer, whispers in phone) Hello?  Yeah... I need to talk to Mister Zimmermann.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle opens the SUITCASE filled with $2 million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie tries not to let his excitement show, but he's awe It's twilight.  They're on the road's narrow shoulder wit the city beginning to sparkle behind.  Cars parked nearby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could start over again with cash like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go wherever you want.  Live how you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more counting the big money for someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beholden to none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's conflicted.  He touches the money, hands trembli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at watch) It's six o'clock.  Time's runaing out.  Decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I tell you, how do I know you won't just club me and take it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't.  It's a gamble.  But, not even in Vegas are you gonna get close to this kind of cash. (emphasizing) This is two million, Archie.  It's not three houses, it's twelve.  It's dreams come true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie's tempted, fearful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Risk it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Archie stares at the money, trance-like.  Then, quietly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just got here.  Like you said, it took about a week from New York...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle, Billy-Boy and Nena share looks, can't believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause) Three hundred kilos of White Lady hidden inside a giant bust of Abraham Lincoln.  A parade float.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks to Kittle) Abe Lincoln...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Coming down the road, hauled by a R,W+B pick-up truck: a giant ABE LINCOLN HEAD parade float, tacky and crude. It's gonna be in the Bicentennial parade on Wilshire tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The float whizzes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see how perfect it is?  It's the fucking Trojan "horse," man.  Nobody suspects a thing...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: In a small town square, country folk gather to look at th Lincoln float and have pictures taken with it. A gift from one city to another, but who's gonna ask who's giving the gift?  It's a great, big, paper-and-glue goodwill ambassador, stopping along the way to promote American values.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Thugs load the lobotomized Abe float with BAGS of HEROIN. Nobody imagines what's inside.  No cops are gonna search it, cause what's to search?  It's not a car. It's not a truck.  It's Abe Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Zimmermann has to do is sit back at his party tonight and wait till the parade's done.  The floats go to some warehouse afterwards, where there's no guards cause it's all garbage in the morning anyhow.  So, while the city sleeps, Zimmermann's guys show up and empty it out. (smiles) It's that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE O.S.!  Bullets hit Archie... Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy turn, reaching for guns... Poe and TWO KILLERS stand on the road, FIRING...
