Kittle, Nena, Billy-Boy and Archie jerk and twist like puppets as BULLETS RIDDLE THEIR BODIES. The suitcase is hit, flipping off the ledge... Money dumps out into Mulholland canyon. Kittle, Nena, Billy-Boy and Archie collapse.  GUNFIRE STO Poe walks over, inspecting.  Smoke wafts.  Kittle, Nena, Billy-Boy and Archie lie motionless in pools of blood. In the canyon, cash flutters down like a blizzard. Poe walks away, taking one killer with him up the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to remaining killer) Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The remaining KILLER goes to put a gun to Billy-Boy's hea pulls back the hammer... pulls the trigger -- CLICK.  Emp Killer reloads, takes his time.  POE'S MUSTANG can be HEA SCREECHING AWAY 0.S.  Killer puts the gun back to Billy-Boy's head, pulls back the hammer... With a sudden ROAR, Billy-Boy awakens, instinctively grabbing Killer's gun and yanking -- SNAPS Killer's arm. Billy-Boy grips Killer's head, twists -- BREAKS Killer's neck.  Killer's dead.  Billy-Boy rises, uneasy, looks around... falls back, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.  A VOICE from blackness: PRESIDENT GERALD FORD. Two hundred years ago we, the people of the United States of America, began a great adventure which stirred the imagination and quickened the hopes of men and women throughout the world.  The date was July 4, 1776; the occasion, the signing of our Declaration of Independence...

dialogues.speaker: BEGINS
dialogues.text: - On WILSHIRE BOULEVARD, the parade's readying.  Floats are guided round a corner: giant BALD EAGLE, massive REVOLUTIONARY SOLDIER with a musket... and, here comes th Abe Lincoln float, pulled by the R,W+B pick-up. - Marching bands mill about, NOISY, disorganized. - Sidewalks seethe with expectant spectators. - Boy Scout troops are lined up by den-leader dads. - Policemen chase a naked STREAKER.  The crowd jeers. - Baton twirling drum majorettes warm up. No other nation in history has ever dedicated itself more specifically nor devoted itself more completely to the proposition that all men are created equal, that they are endowed by their Creator with such unalienable rights of life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - In a HOSPITAL EMERGEMCY ROOM, doors slam open: doctors and interns run all directions as Kittle, Nena, Billy-Boy and Archie are wheeled in on stretchers.  Pandemonium. - Kittle's bloody body is transferred to an operating table.  DOCTOR'S SHOUT ORDERS.  Oxygen's administered. - Surgical scissors cut blood-soaked clothing off Billy-B Same goes for Nena, nearby. - Nena's pupils are checked with a flashlight. - Tubes are fed down Billy-Boy's throat. - Blood flows out bullet holes. - Needles are inserted into veins. - Bloody slugs are dropped in a bowl with a METALLIC PING - Archie's face is covered by a sheet.  Dead. - Kittle gets ELECTRIC SHOCK -- his body convulses. Two centuries later, as we celebrate our Bicentennial Year of Independence, the great American adventure continues. ... Colonists and immigrants brought with them cherished values and ideals in religion and in culture, in law and learning which, mixed with the native American ways, gave us our rich American heritage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - At ZIMMERMANN'S MANSION, champagne corks pop!  People cheer.  A COSTUME PARTY'S beginning in the great room. Distinguished guests flow in.  Lots of whores. Across the room, THUGS drink at a fully stocked bar, each dressed as a REDCOAT.  Poe's amongst them, dressed as BEN FRANKLIN, granny glasses and all. - The butler greets guests in the foyer. - Guests accept R,W+B hors d'oeuvres. - Elsewhere, Zimmermann's entrance is met by applause. He's UNCLE SAM, adjusting his top hat and paste-on beard. - Guests gather round a TELEVISION showing the beginnings the parade on Wilshire. - A STRING QUARTET plays.  Nearby, Zimmermann gives Poe a appreciative slap on the back.  They share a laugh. - Guests share cocaine off coke-spoon necklaces. The unique American union of the known and the unknown, the tried and the untried, has been the foundation for our liberty and the secret of our great success.  In this country, individuals can be the masters rather than the helpless victims of their destiny.  We can make our own opportunities and make the most of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Ford's SPEECH CONTINUES from the TV.  Kittle's the bed, bandaged all over, unconscious. In the space of two centuries, we have not been able to right every wrong, to correct every injustice, to reach every worthy goal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle stirs.  He opens his bleary eyes. But for 200 years, we have tried and we will continue to strive to make the lives of individual men and women in this country and on this Earth better lives -- more hopeful and happy, more prosperous and peaceful, more fulfilling and more free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle tries to sit up, in terrible pain. This is our common dedication, and it will be our common glory as we enter the third century of the American adventure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks to the T.V. as it switches coverage, now SHOWING COVERAGE of the BICENTENNIAL PARADE on Wilshire. Kittle stares at this, then rises, barely, looks to a privacy curtain.  He begins the slow climb out of bed. BEHIND THE CURTAIN, Kittle looks in.  Billy-Boy's out col stained bandages around his head, tubes up his nose. Kittle's eyes fill with tears and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quiet sorrow) What'd they do to my boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle touches Billy-Boy's face, gentle.  Suddenly, Billy-Boy's awake -- gripping Kittle's throat!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choked) ... Billy, no... it's... me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy sees it's Kittle and releases.  Kittle gasps. Billy-Boy pulls tubes out of his body, touches his head wound, looking around, dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They... they shot me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shot us all, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What day is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same day as before.  I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy gets up, in extreme pain, one leg in a knee-to-heel cast.  Kittle helps him out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna rain on Zimmermann's parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Billy-Boy sneak in.  They're pale, wounds bleeding fresh in their bandages.  Kittle goes to check a chart at the end of a bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to bed, whispers) Nena.  Nena...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle pulls the sheet, finds only PILLOWS placed to look like a body.  A LIGHT FALLS ACROSS him from behind... Kittle and Billy-Boy turn.  The bathroom door's falling open, revealing Nena, arm in a sling, struggling to tight a piece of cloth around her wounded leg. Nena looks up, noticing them, manages a frail smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't just stand there... help a lady tighten her tourniquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Many cop cars arriving.  D.A. Ravich and the POLICE CHIEF climb out from one.  FOLLOW as they join a throng of policemen heading to the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Police Chief) I want men guarding their rooms.  As soon as they wake up, I want them booked.  If they die, I want their dead bodies arrested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEHIND, another squad car halts.  Officer Steve and Offic Jim, in unwieldy neck braces, get out from the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops enter, Officers Steve and Jim amongst them.  D.A. Ravich and Police Chief push to front, stopping cold... ZOOM IN: on Billy-Boy and Kittle's empty beds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.A. Ravich and Police Chief rush in with cops.  Same sto Nena's bed empty.  There's a POUNDING HEARD and MUFFLED C Police Chief goes to open a closet... Finds a SECURITY GUARD, bound and gagged, on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics unload an ambulance.  Nurses assist, guiding t stretcher in.  Kittle, Nena and Bllly-Boy hobble past, unnoticed in all the activity. Kittle drops a gun, scrambles to pick it up.  He, Billy-B and Nena climb in the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The purloined ambulance, SIREN WAILING, moves past runnin policemen, past cop cars, to the street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the shooting took place is a crime scene, roped off DETECTIVES work.  The Torino's still here. A SIREN is HEARD... GETTING CLOSER. The ambulance arrives, snapping police tape as it hurtles forward, SKIDDING -- rearends a detective's car, sending car forward and over the edge into the canyon...

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: Policemen, collecting money from foliage, flee.  The car tumbles down... rolling... BURSTING INTO FLAMES.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Our heroes, still in gowns, stumble out the ambulance. Billy-Boy falls and Nena helps him up while Kittle levels his gun shakily at the stupefied detectives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody take off your clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Torino rides again...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TORINO
dialogues.text: Our ragged heroes wear stolen, ill-fitting clothing.  Nen tightens bandages.  In back, Billy-Boy preps weapons from the trunk via the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing back there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood flows out his nose.  He wipes it, trying to ignore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coughs harshly) Feels like there's a bullet still in my chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There probably is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeps working) Bummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARCHING BAND MUSIC 0.S.  Torino's parked, trunk open. Kittle, Billy-B (in football helmet) and Nena unload thei trusty gun duffels, shotgun suitcase and box of dynamite. They trek toward Wilshire, toward the crowd with its back them, where the parade flows past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLINKING a fork against a wine glass, Zimmermann calls fo attention.  Guests clear a space around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment of your time, friends!  A mere moment... (waits for quiet) I welcome you, on this the occasion of America's 200th birthday.  Times like this, I become a sentimental dolt, so I beg your indulgence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the sidewalk, Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy are at the fr of the crowd, watching.  Kittle's looking around, above.. A T.V. CAMERA shoots the parade from atop a high platform WHIP PAN: to another T.V. CAMERA across the street, cover the festivities from another angle. Nena nudges Kittle and points... the Lincoln float's on its way. A MARCHING BAND slows.  The Lincoln float stops behind. DRIVER, a broken-nosed thug, looks impatient.  SPEAKERS o the float BLAST "Stars and Stripes Forever." The pick-up's door opens and Billy-Boy pulls the driver o and throws him.  Behind, Nena and Kittle toss weapons on float, struggling to climb on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann continues his address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our country has been called the land of opportunity. And, a wiser man than I once made the observation that the older you get, the longer it takes you to get to the door when opportunity knocks. (laughter from guests) But, didn't Thomas Jefferson say it best when he said... (sees something O.S., sudden horror and fury) Motherfucking cocksuckers!!  I'll... I'll kill them... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guests are startled.  Zimmermann pushes thru to the television, reddening with rage, quaking in disbelief. ON THE TELEVISION: Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy on the Linc float, blood stains beginning to show thru their clothing waving wearily to cameras.  T.V. ANNOUNCERS in V.0. expre confusion as the float turns off course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy drives, accelerates, spins the wheel... Guides the Lincoln float off the parade route and onto a side street as the panicked crowd parts like the Red Sea. T.V. cameras turn to follow as the float lumbers away. On the float, Nena looks to Kittle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think Zimmermann's watching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck knows?  We'll find out soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redcoat/thugs run from the house, scrambling to black Cadillacs.  Zimmermann follows, shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wilshire Boulevard!  Wilshire Boulevard!  Kill them!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann gets in the passenger side of his white Cadill They ride.  Poe follows in the super Mustang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the float.  Kittle stares up at giant Lincoln.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns my stomach they're using Honest Abe to smuggle their filth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena opens the suitcase, hands a shotgun to Kittle.  Kitt limps aft, aims at the back of Abe Lincoln's head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, old buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM!  White powder leaks out from behind Abe's left ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You John-Wilkes-Booth-ed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pick-up) Billy!  Billy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle moves to the front, shouting.  In the pick-up, Bil glances back, them watches thru the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take us to the beach!  Santa Monica... !  The beach!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy finally nods, gives thumbs-up to show he heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) The beach... the beach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's eyes flutter.  He's sweaty, trying to stay conscious.  He shakes himself, forcing his eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Alright, big-fella, don't you go passing out!  You're fine and dandy. You've had worse than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forces a laugh.  Blood trickles down his forehead.  He takes a pack of cigarettes off the dash. THRU THE WINDSHIELD: yellow traffic light... turning red. Billy-Boy goes for it...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy flouts the intersection, barely missing collisi On the float, Nena starts checking over guns.  Kittle kne behind Abe Lincoln's head, opening the box of dynamite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So there's nobody around to get killed in the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena's confused.  Kittle takes dynamite from the box and starts shoving it into Abe's head cavity, smiles at Nena.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) Oh, yeah... the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I love about dynamite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you bunch it together, it's exponentially more powerful.  Two sticks have the power of four sticks. Four sticks have the power of sixteen, and so on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's what I heard, and that's what I choose to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann's Cadillacs are on the prowl.  Poe follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zimmermann's' Cadillac convoy rounds another corner... Poe's Mustang breaks formation, heading elsewhere...

dialogues.speaker: ON A SIDE STREET
dialogues.text: The Mustang cruises, a strange sight since Poe's at the wheel still in his elaborate Ben Franklin get-up and ther a fully uniformed Redcoat in the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: The thug beside Poe, REDCOAT-ONE, keeps an eye out... DOWN THE BLOCK: a glimpse of Abe crossing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) There!  Over there... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I love about dynamite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the pick-up, Billy-Boy sees the Mustang arrive, headin this way.  He BEEPS and leans out, shouting back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle... we got company!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle and Nena look. Im the Mustang, Poe talks in his CB RADIO, closing. Nena throws her duffel over her shoulder by a strap, star up a ladder at the back of Lincoln's head. Billy-Boy points a gun out his window. Redcoat-One leans out with a machine gun... The pick-up and Mustang TRADE GUNFIRE as they THUNDER pas in opposite directions... Nena reaches the top of Lincoln's stovepipe hat, hurting. BEHIND, the Mustang u-turns to pursue.  And, FURTHER BACK the Cadillacs arrive, SCREEEEEECHING; one white, two blac Here they come, GUNS BLAZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang's all here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep 'em busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle keeps loading dynamite, hurried. Poe's Mustang and the Cadillacs close in. Zimmermann leans out the white Caddie, demented, his Uncl Sam beard flapping in the breeze, FIRING A MACHINE GUN... On the float, Nena RETURNS FIRE from above. Below, Kittle wrestles a plastic bag of heroin out of Lincoln's head, moves back, keeping low... He chucks the heroin bag... The bag SLAMS the windshield of one black Cadillac with a blinding POOF!  Wipers come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my heroin! (to REDCOAT-DRIVER) Move it!  Get beside the son of a bitch!  Now, now, now!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The white Cadillac gets close.  Zimmermann FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Die, Kittle... you self-righteous prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the float, Kittle cowers.  BULLETS RIP Abe's head.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy corners, hard...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Cutting the corner short, blocking the white Cadillac and DECAPITATING a FIRE HYDRANT!  Instant water fountain. Atop Lincoln's hat, Nena hangs on tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the street, five CHILDREN are huddled. flickering flame lights their faces.  They have a G.I. JO DOLL propped up, trying to light the firecracker wedged under its arm.  The fuse sparks. The children run, squealing with delight, turning to watc from the safety of the sidewalk.  The fuse gives off a sizzle.  The children wait... and wait.  Meanwhile, "Star and Stripes Forever" can be HEARD distant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointment) Dud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GUNSHOTS are HEARD.  The children look... Here comes the Lincoln float. It ZOOMS past, followed by the Mustang and Cadillacs... Gunplay... Loud patriotic music... Giant Abe Lincoln. The children watch, awed.  It's gone.  They're still star off in wonder as relative quiet returns. In the street, G.I. Joe's arm gets blown off with a "pop.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the Lincoln float.  Kittle's adding more t.n.t.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WHITE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Zimmermann raises his machine gun, aiming, pauses...

dialogues.speaker: KITTLE
dialogues.text: ZOOM IN: on Kittle and the dynamite-filled hole.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE WHITE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Zimmermann realizes what Kittle's doing.  Dread.  Zimmerm grabs the microphone of his CB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) Hold your fire!  You hear... ?

dialogues.speaker: IN POE'S MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Redcoat-One's SHOOTING.  From the CB: (from radio, garbled) Hold your fire, Goddamn it!  You'll blow it up!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Above on the float, Nena FIRES down... Keeping the villains' cars at bay. Below, Kittle pulls the fuse of one stick of dynamite wit his teeth, lengthening it, then searches his pockets for lighter... remembers these aren't really his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle looks to the pick-up, sees cigarette smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Run them off the road!  Shoot the driver!  Just don't shoot Abraham Lincoln!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Kittle moves to the front, makes the short leap into the of the pick-up.  Short leap, but harshly painful for a ma in Kittle's condition.  He continues...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Kittle leans around to Billy-Boy's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimmie a butt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking a cigarette break, jackass, just give me one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy takes the pack from his pocket and offers it. Kittle slaps the pack away, takes the lit cigarette stick out from Billy-Boy's helmet facemask and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indignant, to Kittle) Rude!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Kittle's heading back, but stops, looking down... In the pick-up, sticking out from under a blanket, there' cardboard BOX labeled "Caution: FLAMMABLE." Kittle shrugs, takes the box... He leaps back onto the float, falls, gets up, returning t the hole behind Lincoln's ear. Kittle opens the box, pleased to find big, rocket-like FIREWORKS, which he quickly starts cramming in the hole. Above, Nena's gun empties.  She flattens, reloading as be she can with only one functioning hand. Behind, one black Cadillac comes ahead. On board the float, Kittle finishes filling the hole and grabs his box of dynamite, moving back, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the RIGHT... NENA looks down from                                  KIT the stovepipe hat.                                    dyn One black Cadillac                                    The pulls along side, SLAMMING... moving                                    Kit beside the pick-up                                    dyn and BASHING! Above, Nena FIRES down, furious...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE BLACK
dialogues.text: CADILLAC, bullets' RIP                                roa thru the roof and kill the Redcoated thugs,                                  Kit swiss-cheesing them!                                  ano Above, Nena tosses one gun, aims another,                                The keeps BLASTING... Below, the black Cadillac swerves off...                            The ot SPLIT-SCREEN ENDS as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullet-ravaged black Cadillac SMACKS a telephone pole With a BOOM!, the other black Cadillac is THROWN UPWARDS the EXPLOSION beneath, flipping and flaming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back) God Bless America!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The white Cadillac jerks to pass the burning wreckage. Poe's Mustang GROWLS, taking the lead... Kittle throws another lit stick of dynamite... The dynamite lands on the white Cadillac's windshield. Inside, Zimmermann's eyes go wide. Zimmermann leans out his window, struggles to reach the stick of dynamite... it's just out of reach... The fuse is very short, sputtering, getting shorter... Zimmermann grunts and groans in terror, straining, can't reach.  Suddenly, he realizes...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Zimmermann gets back in, reaching across the driver to tu on the windshield wipers... WIPERS come to life, SWEEPING, tossing the dynamite away.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The DYNAMITE EXPLODES behind the white Caddie.

dialogues.speaker: AHEAD
dialogues.text: The Mustang RAMS the float from behind.  Redcoat-One FIRE High up on the float, Nena SHOOTS...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Windshield SHATTERS!  Redcoat-One is HIT, spraying blood. Poe cringes and curses...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Mustang slows, pulling back...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Poe wipes flecks of blood off his face, fury building. Redcoat-One's dead.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy glances back, then faces forward.  He yelps... THRU THE WINDSHIELD: a car's crossing.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The pick-up SMASHES the car aside.  JARRING... Kittle's knocked off his feet, cigarette flying. Above, Nena's knocked from the stovepipe hat... She hangs off the edge, barely. Kittle's cigarette lands in the textured crepe-paper-surf of the float, tip glowing. Above, Nena's in trouble.  Her bag of guns slides off... Guns clatter across the pavement below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle!  A little help here... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle rises, stumbling to the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, honey... I'm coming...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Poe speeds up, to the right of the Lincoln float...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Poe pulls close beside the float, reaching with one hand grip the edge.  He climbs out the Mustang's window, pulli himself onto the float as... The driver-less Mustang veers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Romantic.  Candles on tables.  Poe's Mustang CRASHES in, plowing forward.  Diners depart most hastily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the float, Nena shouts a warning to Kittle, but Poe's already jumping to pull Kittle down off the ladder... Poe and Kittle land.  Poe starts PUNCHING... Kittle's getting pounded. BEHIND, in the white Cadillac, an overzealous thug, REDCOAT-TWO, clamors out a rear window, pulling himself u to the car's roof... As the Cadillac gets close... Redcoat-Two runs across the hood, leaping thru the air... Landing on the Lincoln float. Redcoat-Two moves past Poe and Kittle's fisty-cuffs, clim the ladder up Lincoln's head, toward helpless Nena. Nobody notices: the crepe-paper around Kittle's cigarette bursts into flame, fanned by rushing wind.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy looks back... Sees Redcoat-Two reach the top of the stovepipe hat. Billy-Boy BASHES his elbow against his rear window, over over, KNOCKING the window out.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: On the float, the cigarette fire spreads quickly, moving up toward the dynamite-packed hole. Above, Redcoat-Two grins down at Nena, who tries in vain pull herself up with one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grinds his foot down on her hand.  She cries out.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Gun in hand, Billy-B checks his rearview, BRAKES hard...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The Lincoln float LURCHES.  Redcoat-Two falls forward... Nena is thrown, tumbles across the brim of Abe's hat... Kittle and Poe roll, still grappling... Redcoat-Two lands with a THUD in the rear of the pick-up. Nena miraculously lands still on board the float. In the pick-up, Billy-Boy points his gun out the rear win and FIRES REPEATEDLY into Redcoat-Two! Behind, the white Caddie SLAMS the rear of the float... moves along side... BASHING... The float picks up speed, moving over to block.  Poe and Kittle are still beating on each other.  Poe's winning. Kittle's wounds are really bleeding through his clothes n He barely has the strength to punch.  Poe KNOCKS him down Poe KICKS Kittle.  Kittle's not getting up. Poe straddles Kittle, wraps his hands around his neck, choking the life out of him.  Kittle gasps, about to pass out.  Poe grunts, gleeful, strangling.  HONKING is HEARD. Poe looks to the HONKING.  Zimmermann leans out the white Caddie, pointing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind you... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poe turns, too late, as Nena steps up and swings a shotgun -- CLUNK! -- clubbing Poe. Poe goes flying off Kittle. Nena comes to help Kittle up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly) Thanks, doll,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle tries to smile, but spots something horrible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM IN: on the overflowing t.n.t. hole.  Flames climbing the back of Lincoln's head have lit the fuses on several jutting sticks of dynamite! In the white Cadillac, Zimmermann sees the same, mortifie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO MO: Kittle grabs the shotgun from Nena and pushes her ahead of him as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  Go... !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLO-MO: they stumble ahead, toward the pick-up. SLO-MO: Nena leaps into the pick-up. SLO-MO: Kittle follows, in the air, pointing the shotgun down between the pick-up and float, BLASTING... SLO-MO: the shotgun DESTROYS the pick-up's trailer hitch! SLO-MO: Kittle falls into the pick-up. SLO-MO: the Lincoln float is released, slowing... END SLO-MO.  The float rushes back at the white Cadillac with tremendous speed.  Unavoidable IMPACT... The Cadillac RECOILS, out of control...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: Zimmermann screams as...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The white Cadillac CRUNCHES parked cars, tipping on its s and sliding forward, METAL SHRIEKING, sparks flying. On the float, Poe rises, holding his bleeding face.  And. The LINCOLN FLOAT EXPLODES!! It rattles the world... Shatters nearby windows... The FIREBALL lights up the night. WHITE POWDER SHOOTS skyhigh, blooming... Howling FIREWORKS SHOOT ALL DIRECTIONS, red, white + blue

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PICK-UP
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy watches via in his rearview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In back, Kittle and Nena shield their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Poe's flaming body falls from the sky and lands hard. Up the street, it's snowing heroin.  The float topples, w Lincoln's giant head blown wide open and still burning. The pick-up stops.  Our heroes climb out. At the white Cadillac, the driver's head is thru the windshield.  Zimmermann struggles out, gored.  He falls, crawls, looks up.  Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy trudge this direction, spent, barely functioning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (near tears) You fuckers... damn you!  Why?!  Why me!?  Why the obsession with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you accomplished something... like you're heroes? Fuck you!   This is meaningless! You'll never win!  You know, as soon as I'm gone... someone's going to take my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle arrives, grips Zimmermann, pulls him to his feet..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll burn that bridge when we get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kittle PUNCHES Zimmermann, and Kittle's so exhausted that the momentum of his fist throws him off balance... He hits the ground and stays there. Billy-Boy lifts Zimmermann back up, KICKS him, then CLOBB him backwards with an elbow strike... Nena KARATE CHOPS Zimmermann on the fly... Zimmermann falls flat, belly first. Billy-Boy's knees give out and he falls, groggy. Nena kneels to cuff Zimmermann's hands behind him, then backs off, falls back on her ass, exhausted, lays down... Our heroes lie there, staring up at the sky, bleeding, to tired to speak.  SIRENS can be HEARD far away. Neighbors peer out from windows.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE BLOCK
dialogues.text: Squad cars arrive.  Uniformed cops get out. They walk toward the burning Lincoln float, taking in the scene.  They mutter disbelief. They study Poe's burning corpse. Officers Steve and Jim are here, looking at the flaming b of heroin that spilled out of Abe's skull. Officers Steve and Jim share a look of amazement. More cops arrive. From the other end of the street, a plain-clothes car arrives.  D.A. Ravich and Police Chief get out... Cops gather around Billy-Boy, Kittle and Nena, just gawki at them and at Zimmermann, dumbfounded.  Someone whispers that it's Zimmermann. D.A. Ravich and Police Chief push thru the cops to Kittle Nena and Billy-Boy, who make no effort to get up or move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cops) Don't just stand there.  Arrest them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain was dirty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tried to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got the tape to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still to cops) Arrest them!  What are you waiting for?!  Do it!  Someone arrest them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops look at each other.  Behind, AMBULANCES arrive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!  You... (points to YOUNG COP) I'm ordering you to take them into custody this instant!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG COP studies D.A. Ravich, takes his handcuffs of his belt, pauses, then throws the cuffs to D.A. Ravich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Cop goes to help Kittle up.  Other cops join in... D.A. Ravich rants and raves, ignored. As cops help Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy to ambulances, Kittle manages to lift his head, looking up... Far off, FIREWORKS BURST, brightening the skyline. Kittle stops and looks to Nena, sees her noticing them to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Thought I was imagining them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw 'em too.  Fireworks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy-Boy's behind, grinning.  He falls out of the arms o the cops supporting him.  They help pick him back up. Kittle looks back to the fireworks, then to Nena and Bill

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy Independence Day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Happy Fourth of July.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nena manages a smile.  Paramedics arrive to assist... The obligatory CRANE SHOT PULLS UP AND BACK: Kittle, Nena and Billy-Boy receive much needed medical attention.  Cop drag Zimmermann to a squad car.  WHAMMY-BAR THEME SONG is HEARD as CREDITS ROLL...
